text: The Obama administration is offering states and local school districts a lesson plan of sorts for reducing standardized testing in public schools.
headline: Ed Department Gives States Ways to Cut Standardized Testing

text: Hundreds of southeastern Mississippi citizens received jury summons that incorrectly instructed them to call a sex hotline.
headline: Jury Summons Directs People to Call Sex Hotline

text: Britain's Tesco said it has raised pay for its supermarket workers by 3.1 percent to 7.62 pounds ($10.96) per hour, meaning it will give a significantly higher rate than the British government's new National Living Wage.
headline: Tesco Raises UK Store Worker Pay by 3.1 Percent

text: European and U.S. negotiators agreed a data pact on Tuesday that should prevent European Union regulators from restricting data transfers by companies such as Google and Amazon across the Atlantic.
headline: Exclusive-New European, U.S. Data Transfer Pact Agreed

text: Romania's general prosecutor resigned Tuesday over allegations he illegally benefited from the use of official motorcades, a topic which has provoked debate and outrage in Romania.
headline: Romania General Prosecutor Quits Over Motorcade Allegations

text: Mobile phone networks operator Vodafone said on Tuesday it was in talks with John Malone's cable company Liberty Global about forming a joint venture in the Netherlands.
headline: Vodafone in Talks With Liberty Global on Dutch Joint Venture

text: UPS nearly tripled its fourth-quarter profit and seemed to avoid many of the holiday package-delivery breakdowns that it suffered a year earlier.
headline: UPS 4Q Profit of $1.33 Billion Beats Wall Street Forecasts

text: U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter said on Tuesday the Pentagon would seek a $582.7 billion defense budget next year and reshape spending priorities to reflect a new strategic environment marked by Russian assertiveness and the rise of Islamic State.
headline: U.S. Defense Budget Focuses on Changing Security Environment: Carter

text: Russia scolded British Foreign Secretary Philip Hammond on Tuesday for suggesting that President Vladimir Putin was fanning the flames of the Syrian civil war.
headline: Russia Scolds UK's Hammond for Saying Putin Fanning Syrian Civil War

text: Officials say about 1,200 fish are dead after an operational glitch at a central Pennsylvania power plant caused cold water to be sent into the Susquehanna River.
headline: Official: About 1,200 Fish Killed After Power Plant Glitch

text: Britain could hold its European Union membership referendum within "a few months" if other EU countries back a series of proposed changes to the bloc which were announced earlier on Tuesday, Prime Minister David Cameron said.
headline: UK Referendum on EU Could Take Place in Few Months: Cameron

text: Chancellor Angela Merkel's cabinet will provide tax incentives to investors who build new flats in urban areas, in a drive to tackle a drastic shortage of affordable housing aggravated by a record influx of refugees, officials said on Tuesday.
headline: Germany Aims to Boost Housing Construction With Tax Incentives

text: Michigan's top environmental regulator says the state should have required the city of Flint to treat its water for corrosion after elevated lead levels were first discovered in the city's water a year ago.
headline: Official: Michigan Should Have Required Flint to Treat Water

text: The chief Syrian government delegate at Geneva peace talks said on Tuesday it was too early for indirect contacts while a U.N. envoy's meeting with the opposition was canceled after a major Russian-backed offensive on rebel positions.
headline: Syrian Government Says Too Early for Talks, Opposition Avoids U.N.

text: The 20-year-old son of an Episcopal priest has been sentenced to life in prison without parole for beating his parents to death with a lamp, baseball hat and hammer.
headline: Priest's Son Gets Life, No Parole for Killing His Parents

text: Authorities say a Pennsylvania man tried to sell drugs in a Pittsburgh traffic court.
headline: Man Accused of Trying to Sell Drugs in Traffic Court

text: The big plunge in crude prices is taking a toll on Big Oil.
headline: Exxon's 4Q and Annual Profit Plunge With Oil Prices

text: Exxon Mobil Corp on Tuesday reported its smallest quarterly profit in more than a decade and said it will cut 2016 spending by one-quarter and suspend share repurchases as it copes with a prolonged downturn in crude prices.
headline: Exxon Slashes Spending After Smallest Profit in Years

text: U.S. auto sales fell slightly in January because of the East Coast snowstorm, but analysts say demand remains strong and buyers will likely head back into dealerships this month.
headline: January US Auto Sales Fall Slightly Due to Storm

text: The party of Myanmar's Aung San Suu Kyi has instructed its lawmakers not to leave the capital, rank-and-file members said, fuelling speculation of a legal bid to sidestep a clause in the constitution barring the democracy champion from the presidency.
headline: Travel Ban Fuels Talk of Myanmar Constitutional Challenge

text: A military general who criticized Uganda's longtime president was charged in a court-martial and remanded to jail, but his supporters say he is the victim of state persecution.
headline: Dissident General in Uganda Charged, Faces Court-Martial

text: Venezuelan driver Pastor Maldonado has not given up on Formula One and hopes to be back next year after being dropped by the Renault-owned Lotus team, his manager Nicolas Todt said on Tuesday.
headline: Maldonado Hoping for 2017 Return to F1, Says Manager

text: U.S. auto sales fared better than expected in January as the industry continued to benefit from low gasoline prices, easy credit and moderate economic growth, major automakers said on Tuesday.
headline: U.S. January Auto Sales Stronger Than Expected

text: A union leader of Pakistan's national airline says security forces opened fire on an anti-privatization rally in the port city of Karachi, killing two employees.
headline: Union: 2 Pakistan Airline Workers Killed by Police at Rally

text: At least one person was killed in a grenade attack on a bar in Burundi on Monday night, witnesses said, in more violence since the African Union backed away from sending in peacekeepers without the government's consent.
headline: Grenade Attack Kills One as Burundi Violence Continues

text: The Federal Bureau of Investigation said on Tuesday it was joining a criminal investigation of lead-contaminated drinking water in Flint, Michigan, exploring whether laws were broken in a crisis that has captured international attention.
headline: FBI Joins Probe of Flint, Michigan's Lead Contaminated Water

text: China's state-owned ChemChina is nearing a deal to buy Swiss seeds and pesticides group Syngenta for around 43 billion Swiss francs ($42.2 billion), two people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.
headline: ChemChina Close to Striking Deal for Syngenta: Sources

text: A set of proposals to keep Britain in the European Union will help Britain better control immigration and, if agreed, would be legally binding and irreversible, a spokeswoman for Prime Minister David Cameron said on Tuesday.
headline: UK's EU Deal Would Be Legally Binding, Irreversible: Cameron's Spokeswoman

text: A Syrian military offensive backed by heavy Russian air strikes threatened to cut critical rebel supply lines into the northern city of Aleppo on Tuesday, while the warring sides said peace talks had not started despite a U.N. statement they had.
headline: Syrian Army Threatens to Encircle Aleppo as Talks Falter

text: The leader of Spain's Socialists Pedro Sanchez said he would accept to lead talks between political parties to form a government if King Felipe nominates him after wrapping up a second round of consultations on Tuesday.
headline: Spain's Socialists Say Ready to Lead Talks to Form Government

text: Iraq on Tuesday awarded an Italian company a contract to overhaul and maintain the Mosul dam in the country's north, days after a U.S. general warned of its possible collapse.
headline: Iraq Awards Contract for Repairing Major Dam

text: French high schools say students should be allowed to smoke on school grounds so that they don't become targets for extremists when they gather for cigarette breaks on the street outside.
headline: French Schools Cite Extremism as Reason to Lift Smoking Ban

text: A close friend and key adviser of former Czech Prime Minister Mirek Topolanek has been convicted of bribery and sentenced to five years in prison.
headline: Close Ally of Former Czech PM Convicted in Bribery Case

text: U.S. stocks dropped on Tuesday after another steep fall in oil prices and a disappointing spending forecast from Exxon Mobil.
headline: Wall Street Slides With Exxon, Oil; Chipotle Dips After Close

text: Police have seized hundreds of thousands of euros worth of fake champagne in a workshop near Padua, northern Italy, with counterfeiters looking to pass off sparkling wine as Moet & Chandon.
headline: Italy Busts Fake Champagne Makers With Thousands of 'Moet' Bottles

text: Ireland's unemployment rate has fallen to a seven-year low of 8.6 percent as the country — buoyant again after years of gloom and austerity — faces an election.
headline: Irish Unemployment Falls to 7-Year Low of 8.6 Percent

text: Israel's parliament passed a law on Tuesday expanding police powers, allowing them to stop and frisk suspects without probable cause, the latest attempt to crack down on near-daily Palestinian attacks on Israelis.
headline: Israeli Lawmakers Approve New Stop and Frisk Laws

text: The criminal charges in the George Washington Bridge lane-closing case should be thrown out because they are based on vague federal laws that have been twisted to fit the facts of the case, two former allies of Gov. Chris Christie wrote in separate court filings late Monday.
headline: Bridge Case Defendants Ask Judge to Throw Out Case

text: Smokers in Italy are now facing fines of up to 500 euros ($600) if they light up in a car with a child or pregnant woman — or if they toss a cigarette butt on the street — after new health and environmental laws went into effect Tuesday.
headline: Smokers in Italy Hit With New Fines to Protect the Young

text: FIFA has appealed for a ban on South Korean player, Kang Soo-il, to be increased to two years, the second increase after he was banned for 15 games then six months for failing a doping test last year.
headline: FIFA Wants Two-Year Ban for South Korean Who Failed Doping Test

text: Dow Chemical’s chief executive Andrew Liveris, fresh from orchestrating a $130 billion merger with U.S. rival DuPont, on Tuesday announced plans to retire by mid-2017, a step he takes after years of pitched battles with an activist shareholder unhappy with his leadership.
headline: Dow Chemical CEO Plans Retirement and Handover in 2017

text: Police in western Germany say unidentified assailants have thrown two gasoline bombs into the grounds of a mosque, but there was no damage and no one was injured.
headline: Assailants Throw Gasoline Bombs Into German Mosque's Grounds

text: Fear of missing out on English football's biggest ever payday drove the Premier League's relegation-threatened clubs on a spending spree in January, with Championship sides hoping for promotion also splashing the cash.
headline: Fear of Missing Out Drives English Club Spending

text: Comedian Bill Cosby on Tuesday sought to derail Pennsylvania prosecutors' effort to make him stand trial on sexual assault charges, contending that a deal reached over a decade ago gave him immunity from prosecution.
headline: Cosby Seeks to Block Sex Assault Prosecution in Pennsylvania

text: Pfizer Inc.'s fourth-quarter profit fell by half due to higher costs for production, administration and restructuring, but new revenue from an acquisition helped the world's second-biggest drugmaker beat Wall Street expectations.
headline: Pfizer Earnings Fall but Tops Street 4Q Forecasts

text: A 72-year-old man convicted of murdering a convenience store manager in a 1979 robbery in Atlanta's suburbs is set to be executed on Tuesday in Georgia.
headline: Georgia to Execute Its Oldest Death Row Inmate for 1979 Murder

text: Proposals to protect Britain and other non-euro zone countries from deeper euro zone integration do not grant London the right of veto over decisions, European Council President Donald Tusk told EU leaders in a letter on Tuesday.
headline: EU Draft Deal on Britain Not a Euro Zone Veto: Tusk Letter

text: Pakistani security personnel on Tuesday clashed with marchers protesting government plans to privatize the ailing national airline, a skirmish that a hospital official said killed at least two protesters and injured eight.
headline: Security Officials, Protesters Clash During Pakistan Strike

text: The president of the Corporate Council on Africa says official corruption is discouraging many U.S businesses from investing in Africa.
headline: Corrupt Practices Said to Be Hurting US Biz Goals in Africa

text: U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc on Tuesday forecast 2016 revenue and earnings below analysts' estimates, largely because of the strong dollar.
headline: Pfizer 2016 Forecast Disappoints

text: Prime Minister David Cameron hailed his deal with the European Union as proof he was making real progress in renegotiating Britain's terms with the bloc, but said there was still more work to do.
headline: Britain's Cameron Hails New EU Proposals, Says More Work to Do

text: The Latest on negotiations on changes to EU law aimed at keeping Britain in the bloc (all times local):
headline: The Latest: Hungary Accepts UK Efforts to Stop Benefit Abuse

text: It may sound like a flight of fancy, but Dutch police are considering using birds of prey to swoop down and pluck rogue drones out of the sky.
headline: Eagles vs Drones: Dutch Police Eye Birds to Prey on Drones

text: Two Australians were diagnosed with the Zika virus after returning home from travels in the Caribbean, a state health service said on Tuesday, confirming the first cases of the mosquito-borne virus in the country this year.
headline: Australia Reports Two Cases of Zika Virus, Detects Mosquitoes at Sydney Airport

text: Dutch police puzzling over how to remove drones that pose a public safety threat are testing a way to get the job done in one fell swoop - with trained eagles.
headline: Dutch Police Train Eagles to Snatch Enemy Drones

text: The Zika virus has hit India's Tata Motors, which has decided to rebrand a soon-to-be launched hatchback vehicle which was to have been called Zica, an abbreviation of "Zippy Car."
headline: Zika Virus Forces India's Tata Motors to Change Car's Name

text: Britain would be justified in denying benefits to new EU migrants working in the country under proposals designed to help persuade Britons to stay in the bloc, according to a draft seen by Reuters on Tuesday.
headline: Britain Could Deny New Migrant Benefits Under EU Deal: Draft

text: The latest on U.N hosted peace negotiations in Geneva aimed at ending Syria's devastating five-year conflict (all times local):
headline: The Latest: Opposition Has 'No Optimism' for Peace Talks

text: TE Connectivity Ltd, a Swiss-based manufacturer of electronics and sensors, said it would buy Creganna Medical Group for $895 million, expanding in the fast-growing business of making equipment used in minimally invasive procedures.
headline: TE Connectivity Pushes Into Medical Devices With Creganna Buy

text: The Pentagon's next five-year budget proposal seeks over $13 billion in funding for a new submarine to carry nuclear ballistic missiles, plus orders for more Boeing Co and Lockheed Martin Corp fighter jets, according to sources familiar with the plans.
headline: Exclusive: U.S. Budget Plan Includes Over $13 Billion for New Submarine-Sources

text: Some conservationists oppose the planned relocation of 18 elephants from Swaziland to zoos in the United States, but a U.S. official has said the animal transfer can be done humanely and is permissible under international law.
headline: Swaziland to Send 18 Elephants to American Zoos

text: Aston Villa manager Remi Garde says the danger of his club toppling out of the Premier League and a reluctance to spend big meant that he failed to make any signings during the transfer window that could have helped the team stay up.
headline: Villa's Garde Down but Not Out After Deadline Debacle

text: U.S. drug developer NewLink Genetics Corp joined the race to develop a vaccine for the Zika virus, a day after the World Health Organization declared the mosquito-borne disease an international public health emergency.
headline: NewLink Genetics Says Working on Zika Vaccine

text: European Union regulators proposed on Tuesday to roll out a key mobile spectrum across the 28-nation bloc to improve access to internet services and technologies, including in remote areas.
headline: EU Plans to Coordinate a Key Mobile Spectrum in Europe

text: A glance at the films in the main program at this year's Berlin International Film Festival, the event's 66th edition, which runs from Feb. 11-21. Original title followed in parentheses by English title given by the festival, where applicable and available.
headline: A List of Films in the Main Program at the Berlin Festival

text: The first known case of Zika virus transmission in the United States was reported in Texas on Tuesday by local health officials, who said it likely was contracted through sex and not a mosquito bite, a day after the World Health Organization declared an international public health emergency.
headline: First U.S. Zika Virus Transmission Reported, Attributed to Sex

text: Ireland's unemployment rate fell to 8.6 percent in January from 8.8 percent a month earlier, the central statistics office said on Tuesday, a boost for Prime Minister Enda Kenny as he prepares to call parliamentary elections for later this month.
headline: Irish Unemployment Falls to 8.6 Percent on Eve of Election Call

text: The head of an international group monitoring South Sudan's peace process said Tuesday that people are starving in the country's Western Equatoria state as the government and rebels delay forming a transitional government to end the country's civil war.
headline: Official: Starvation in South Sudan as Peace Process Stalls

text: The Obama administration said Tuesday it will propose quadrupling what it spends on its troops and training in Europe, as part of the U.S. military's accelerating effort to deter Russia.
headline: US Proposes More Pentagon Funding for Europe Aid, Equipment

text: French Finance Minister Michel Sapin on Tuesday ruled out striking a deal with Google over back taxes as the British government recently did with the U.S. internet giant.
headline: France Rules Out Negotiating With Google Over Back Taxes

text: New movies starring Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman and Kirsten Dunst will compete for the top honors at this year's Berlin International Film Festival with offerings from Iran, Tunisia the Philippines and elsewhere, with Meryl Streep presiding over the jury that will choose the winners.
headline: Berlin Offers Stars, Global Offerings for Streep-Led Jury

text: The Czechs, the biggest beer consumers in the world, could soon have a reason to drink even more after the finance minister proposed lowering tax on the drink by more than half.
headline: Czechs, World's Top Beer Drinkers, May Get Even Cheaper Brew

text: The latest on developments in the Iowa caucuses and the follow-up New Hampshire primary (all times local):
headline: The Latest: Trump Bemoans His Iowa Ground Game

text: LOS ANGELES - Pop singer Mariah Carey will hit the road again for a European tour starting next month -- her first show dates on the continent since 2003.
headline: Mariah Carey 'Looking Forward' to Returning to Europe

text: Unsettled Chelsea defender Gary Cahill has held "positive" talks with interim manager Guus Hiddink about his future and said he was keen to stay at the club.
headline: Cahill Keen to Stay at Chelsea After 'Positive' Talks

text: A global maritime watchdog said Tuesday that ship hijackings declined in 2015 from a year earlier, while sea piracy incidents increased slightly but consisted mostly of low-level theft.
headline: Ship Hijackings Down in 2015, Piracy Mostly Low-Level Theft

text: The Danish government decided on Tuesday to extend temporary control over the country's border with Germany by 20 days to February 23, Minister for Immigration, Integration and Housing Inger Stojberg told reporters in parliament.
headline: Denmark Extends Border Control on Border With Germany

text: London Mayor Boris Johnson, yet to declare whether he will campaign to keep Britain in the European Union, said on Tuesday he did not think new proposals designed to keep Britain in the bloc went far enough.
headline: London Mayor Says New EU Proposals 'Not Enough'

text: Known for his famous subjects, from politicians and royalty to Hollywood celebrities, portrait artist Jonathan Yeo explores different ways of looking at the same person in his latest work -- a series of paintings of model and actress Cara Delevingne.
headline: With Cara Delevingne as Muse, Artist Yeo Presents New Portraits

text: India's top court on Tuesday agreed to re-examine a colonial-era law that makes homosexual acts punishable by up to a decade in prison.
headline: India's Top Court to Re-examine Gay Rights

text: The German government says Chancellor Angela Merkel has urged President Vladimir Putin to use Russia's influence with separatists in eastern Ukraine to help secure progress toward a political solution.
headline: Germany's Merkel Presses Putin on Ukraine Separatists

text: India limited-overs specialist Suresh Raina is to captain the new Indian Premier League (IPL) franchise in Rajkot, the team announced on Tuesday, while confirming Australian Brad Hodge as the side's coach.
headline: Raina to Captain Rajkot IPL Team, Hodge Named as Coach

text: The Latest on the battle against the Zika virus (all times local):
headline: The Latest: Chile Reports Its First 3 Confirmed Zika Cases

text: The Latest on migrants seeking sanctuary in Europe (all times local):
headline: The Latest: Greek Armed Forces to Help Build Migrant Centers

text: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Wednesday:
headline: 10 Things to Know for Wednesday

text: A pivotal "in or out" referendum on Britain's future in the European Union moved one step closer Tuesday as British and European leaders presented new draft proposals aimed at keeping the 28-nation EU intact.
headline: Brussels Proposals to Keep Britain in the EU Under Scrutiny

text: Italy is working with the Egyptian government to find an Italian student from Britain's Cambridge University who went missing last week in Cairo, where he was carrying out doctoral research, an Italian diplomat and friends of the student said Tuesday.
headline: Search Underway for Italian Student Missing in Cairo

text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel pressed Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday to use his influence to ensure a ceasefire is upheld in eastern Ukraine and OSCE monitors are granted free access to conflict areas, her spokesman said.
headline: Merkel Presses Putin to Ensure Ukraine Ceasefire Holds

text: Perennial under-achievers Tottenham Hotspur will not buckle under the pressure of being involved in the Premier League title race and can show they are Champions League candidates, midfielder Eric Dier said.
headline: Spurs Will Not Buckle Under Title Race Pressure, Says Dier

text: The total number of migrants and refugees arriving in Greece in January topped 62,000, the International Organization for Migration said on Tuesday.
headline: More Than 62,000 Migrant Arrivals in Greece Last Month: IOM

text: A 5-year-old Afghan boy who made a splash on the Internet by wearing a homemade Lionel Messi jersey might get the chance to meet the Barcelona great.
headline: 5-Year-Old Afghan Boy Could Get to Meet Lionel Messi

text: Prehistoric cave-dwellers enjoyed munching on tortoises roasted in their shells as an appetiser or side dish, Ran Barkai, an archaeologist at Tel Aviv University, said on Tuesday.
headline: Prehistoric Man Enjoyed Roasted Tortoise Appetisers, Israeli Archaeologist Says

text: Senior Syrian opposition negotiator Mohamed Alloush, representing Jaish al-Islam (Islam Army), a major rebel group, said on Tuesday he was not optimistic about the prospects for peace talks in Geneva.
headline: Senior Opposition Negotiator Alloush Says Not Optimistic on Talks

text: Thailand should not worry about the Zika virus, its public health ministry said on Tuesday, just a day after the World Health Organization declared the virus an international emergency.
headline: Thai Health Ministry Says Don't Panic Over Zika Virus

text: Cuba sought to drum up foreign investment on Tuesday as ministers on a state visit to Paris promised French business leaders that the Communist-run country is open for business.
headline: Cuba Open for Business, Ministers Tell French Executives

text: Two-time Tour de France winner Chris Froome has said he warned authorities about possible mechanical doping in cycling and wants them to intensify bike checks to catch offenders.
headline: Froome Says Had Warned UCI Against Mechanical Doping

text: Australian director George Miller will preside over the 69th Cannes film festival, organizers said on Tuesday.
headline: Mad Max Director George Miller to Preside Over Cannes Film Festival

text: India's top court on Tuesday said it will review a decision over whether to uphold a colonial-era law that criminalises gay sex in a victory for homosexual rights campaigners at a time when the nation is navigating a path between tradition and modernity.
headline: India's Supreme Court Will Review Law Criminalising Gay Sex

text: The Syrian government allowed aid into a rebel-held area near Damascus on Tuesday in what appeared to be a goodwill gesture after U.N.-mediated indirect peace talks got off to a rocky start in Geneva.
headline: Syria Allows Aid Into Rebel-Held Area as Peace Talks Stall

text: Nine people, including two babies, were found drowned off the coast of western Turkey on Tuesday after a boat carrying people to Greece partly capsized, the coast guard said.
headline: Nine Migrants, Including Two Babies Drowned Off Turkish Coast-Coastguard

text: Swiss bank UBS saw its shares slide on Tuesday on news that investors had pulled billions out of its division serving wealthy clients — a token of the market turbulence that has shaken the world in the past few months.
headline: UBS Bank Shares Plunge as Rich Investors Withdraw Money

text: Jordan's King Abdullah says his country needs long-term aid from the international community to cope with a huge influx of Syrian refugees, warning that unless it received support the "dam is going to burst".
headline: Jordan Needs International Help Over Refugee Crisis: King Abdullah

text: Prices at factory gates in the 19 countries sharing the euro fell by more than expected in December, in another sign of the challenges facing the European Central Bank in bringing inflation nearer to its medium-term target.
headline: Euro Zone Factory Prices Add to ECB Headache but Unemployment Falls

text: Unemployment across the 19-country eurozone fell in December for the 15th month running to its lowest level in a little more than four years, official figures showed Tuesday.
headline: Eurozone Unemployment Edges Down for 15th Month Running

text: Tens of thousands of trapped Iraqi civilians are running out of food and medicine in the western city of Falluja, an Islamic State stronghold under siege by security forces, according to local officials and residents.
headline: Iraqis Running Out of Food and Medicine in Besieged Falluja

text: Tornadoes touched down in Mississippi and Alabama as thunderstorms swept through the area Tuesday, while a powerful snowstorm buried parts of Colorado and Nebraska in more than a foot of snow before crawling into the Upper Midwest.
headline: Tornadoes in the South; Snow in Plains and Upper Midwest

text: China's Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday its law enforcement officials would never do anything illegal, especially not overseas, after the United States called on China to clarify the status of five missing Hong Kong booksellers.
headline: China Defends Law Enforcers as U.S. Calls for Clarity on Booksellers

text: Leicester City's unexpected surge to the top of the Premier League is not due to a change in mentality but because of the team's ability to keep a level head no matter where they find themselves in the table, goalkeeper Kasper Schmeichel has said.
headline: Leicester Keeping Calm at Premier League Peak-Schmeichel

text: The military strategy for eliminating the Islamic State in Libya appeared on hold Tuesday as nations fighting the extremist group said they could help the North African country re-establish security once its long-awaited new government is established.
headline: Libya's Political Chaos Slows Response to Islamic State

text: Former McLaren test and reserve driver Gary Paffett has joined Formula One rivals Williams to help them develop their new car in the simulator.
headline: Former McLaren Test Driver Paffett Joins Williams

text: A Turkish news agency says at least nine migrants — two of them children — have drowned in a new boat sinking accident off the Turkish coast.
headline: Report: 9 Migrants, Including 2 Children, Drown Off Turkey

text: A Scottish tourist has been gored to death by an elephant that he and his 16-year-old stepdaughter were riding on the resort island of Samui, Thai authorities said Tuesday.
headline: Thai Elephant Gores Scottish Tourist to Death on Trek

text: Russia has agreed that two Syrian rebel Islamist groups will participate in Syria peace talks on an individual basis but said this did not mean that they were legitimate and not terrorists, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Tuesday.
headline: Islamist Groups in Syria Talks on Individual Basis-Russia

text: Kenyan military personnel have killed four suspected al Shabaab fighters after a fierce shootout in a forest on the north coast, a government official said on Tuesday.
headline: Kenya Security Kill Four Suspected Al Shabaab Fighters in Lamu-Official

text: The European Union's ambassador to Russia said on Tuesday he was appalled by "disgusting" murder threats made by Chechnya's leader Ramzan Kadyrov to Mikhail Kasyanov, a Russian opposition figure, and urged the authorities to react immediately.
headline: EU Envoy Appalled by Putin Ally's Murder Threats to Russian Opposition Figure

text: Bernie Sanders says his razor-thin contest against Hillary Clinton in Iowa is giving his campaign a "kick-start."
headline: Sanders Says Iowa Gives Campaign a Kick-Start

text: Florida's highest court has delayed the execution of a condemned inmate, just weeks after the U.S. Supreme Court found flaws in the way the state sentences people to death.
headline: Florida Delays Execution as State Works on New System

text: China's envoy for the North Korean nuclear issue arrived in the capital, Pyongyang, on Tuesday, the North's KCNA news agency reported, amid a push by the United States and South Korea for tougher sanctions on the North after its fourth nuclear test.
headline: China's Nuclear Envoy in North Korea Amid Sanctions Push: KCNA

text: Nigerian separatists have hijacked a merchant ship and threatened to blow it up with its foreign crew if authorities do not release a detained leader agitating for a breakaway state of Biafra, military officers said Tuesday.
headline: Nigerian Separatists Hijack Ship, Demand Release of Leader

text: A sheriff's deputy justifiably shot and paralyzed an unarmed black man because the man's actions made the deputy believe he was drawing a gun and was about to shoot him, a police training expert told a federal court jury Tuesday.
headline: Expert: Deputy Justifiably Shot Unarmed Man Over Dark Object

text: Drugmaker Sanofi Pasteur said Tuesday it is launching an effort to research and develop a vaccine to prevent the Zika virus, after the World Health Organization declared a global emergency over its explosive spread across the Americas.
headline: Drugmaker Sanofi Pasteur Launches Effort for Zika Vaccine

text: Manchester City striker Kelechi Iheanacho is poised to become the benefactor of a mini-injury crisis at the club after manager Manuel Pellegrini confirmed that the Nigerian teenager has been included in his Champions League squad.
headline: Man City's Iheanacho to Be Given Champions League Chance

text: Iran's national carrier has signed an agreement to buy 20 new passenger airplanes with an option for 20 more from French-Italian aircraft manufacturer ATR, Iranian media reported Tuesday.
headline: Iran Signs Deal to Buy 20 More Airplanes

text: After a year of secret diplomacy and hushed-up private talks around the world, OPEC's mighty Saudi Arabia and rival Venezuela were persuaded to cut a deal by non-OPEC Mexico which overcame mutual acrimony and led to a much-needed rise in oil prices.
headline: A New Global Oil Deal Could Draw Lessons From 1998

text: Growth in Britain's construction industry was its weakest in nine months in January after a short-lived recovery in December, a survey published on Tuesday showed.
headline: UK Construction Growth Slips to Nine-Month Low in January-PMI

text: U.S. Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz's victory on Monday in corn-rich Iowa could represent a major blow to the country's controversial biofuels program, reflecting its waning influence over politicians even in the U.S. farm heartland.
headline: Cruz's Iowa Victory Could Show Big Corn's Waning Influence

text: Volkswagen's passenger car sales fell 8.8 percent in Germany in January, official registration data showed, while overall car sales in Europe's largest market rose 3.3 percent from a year earlier.
headline: VW Car Sales in Germany Fall 8.8 Percent in January

text: A 13-year-old girl who vanished from her bedroom was stabbed to death by a Virginia Tech student, and another freshman already charged with hiding the body was more deeply involved, authorities said Tuesday. A neighbor said the seventh-grader told friends she would sneak out to meet her "boyfriend" David, an 18-year-old she met online through the Kik messaging app.
headline: Neighbor: Slain Virginia Girl Talked of Online 'Boyfriend'

text: China's point man on North Korea arrived in Pyongyang, the country's capital, on Tuesday amid a flurry of diplomacy over the North's recent nuclear test.
headline: Senior Chinese Official Arrives in North Korea

text: Socialist head Pedro Sanchez was named on Tuesday by King Felipe to lead talks to form a government in Spain, although chances of success are slim as he would need to strike a deal with several parties whose policies are incompatible.
headline: Socialists to Try to Form Government in Spain, but Chances Slim

text: Sanofi has launched a project to develop a vaccine against the Zika virus in the most decisive commitment yet by a major vaccine producer to fight the disease linked to multiple birth defects in Brazil.
headline: Sanofi Launches Hunt for Zika Vaccine as Disease Fears Grow

text: Punxsutawney Phil, the Pennsylvania groundhog renowned for his ability to forecast the onset of spring, did not see his shadow after emerging from his burrow on Tuesday morning, predicting an early spring.
headline: U.S. Groundhog Punxsutawney Phil Predicts Early Spring

text: Super Rugby organisers announced a change in the penalty rules on Tuesday and confirmed a new attacking bonus point system aimed at making matches more competitive.
headline: Super Rugby Change Rules to Encourage Attacking Play

text: A vice mayor in a key southeastern Chinese city will be prosecuted for graft after an investigation found he engaged in "superstitious" activities, abused his power and took bribes, China's main anti-graft watchdog said on Tuesday.
headline: 'Superstitious' Chinese Vice Mayor to Be Prosecuted for Graft

text: After a year of secret diplomacy and hushed-up private talks around the world, OPEC's mighty Saudi Arabia and rival Venezuela were persuaded to cut a deal by non-OPEC Mexico which overcame mutual acrimony and led to a much-needed rise in oil prices.
headline: A New Global Oil Deal Could Draw Lessons From 1998

text: German unemployment fell more sharply than expected in January and the jobless rate dropped to a record low, suggesting private consumption will help offset a slowdown in emerging markets to keep growth in Europe's largest economy steady.
headline: German Jobless Rate Falls to Lowest Level on Record

text: Qatari sportsman Nasser Al Attiyah has swapped the steering wheel for the shotgun as the twice Dakar Rally winner targets a sixth Olympic appearance at the Rio de Janeiro Games in August.
headline: Qatar's Al Attiyah Gunning for Sixth Olympic Appearance

text: A French police official says five people were arrested outside the city of Lyon with plans to stage attacks on nightspots and leave for Syria.
headline: Arrests in France Thwart Attack on Nightspots, Official Says

text: Britain's top share index fell sharply on Tuesday, knocked down by a drop in BP after the oil major reported its biggest ever annual loss.
headline: FTSE Bruised by BP

text: Lawmakers can now breastfeed in the Australian Parliament after the government changed the rules on Tuesday to make politics more family-friendly. But none of the nursing mothers appeared keen to take up the opportunity.
headline: Lawmakers Allowed to Breastfeed in Australian Parliament

text: Haiti's opposition on Tuesday rejected a proposal by outgoing President Michel Martelly to form a temporary government to organise elections, after a run-off presidential vote was cancelled last month amid violence and allegations of fraud.
headline: Haiti Opposition Rejects President's Plan for Interim Government

text: Hillary Clinton's struggle in Iowa to fend off underdog Bernie Sanders, a self-described democratic socialist, reignited questions about her ability to close the deal with Democratic voters and turned up the pressure on her high-profile White House campaign.
headline: Virtual Tie Raises Doubts: Can Hillary Clinton Close the Deal?

text: A bomb threat on a plane preparing to leave Faro airport in Portugal's southern region of Algarve for Lisbon forced the evacuation of its 38 passengers early on Tuesday, a spokesman for the country's flag carrier TAP said.
headline: Passengers Evacuated After Bomb Threat on Local Portugal Flight

text: The Syrian army and its allies made further advances on Tuesday in a major offensive that could cut insurgents' supply lines between the north western city of Aleppo and the Turkish border, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.
headline: Syrian Army, Allies Press Major Offensive North of Aleppo

text: Three teen brothers are suspected in a drug-related shooting that left two people dead and three wounded at a well-known Seattle homeless camp, a crime that comes as the city struggles with a surge of people living on the streets.
headline: 3 Teens Arrested in Deadly Shooting at Seattle Homeless Camp

text: The Japan Golf Tour Organization (JGTO) are keen to increase their involvement in co-sanctioned events abroad but remain opposed to any radical changes to Asia's organizational structure, a senior director told Reuters.
headline: Japan Tour Keen to Spread Wings Without Structural Change

text: Authorities in Cyprus have in the last two years prevented 18 foreign nationals from heading to Syria and possibly joining the Islamic State Group through the ethnically divided island's breakaway Turkish Cypriot north, an official said Tuesday.
headline: Source: Cyprus Blocks 18 Syria-Bound Foreigners, 15 Succeed

text: The U.N. says that international donors have only pledged a "paltry" one per cent of the $166 million funding appeal launched to assist over one million Libyans affected by the country's raging conflict.
headline: UN Aid Appeal for War-Torn Libya Only 1 Per Cent Funded

text: The U.S. Department of Justice said it will examine use of force and ethnic disparities in arrests as part of a review of the San Francisco Police Department amid heightened racial tensions.
headline: San Francisco Police Face US Justice Department Review

text: Spain's king on Tuesday tapped Socialist leader Pedro Sanchez to try to form a government following an inconclusive December election in which the country's conservative Popular Party came in first but failed to drum up enough support for a coalition or a minority government.
headline: Spain's Socialist Leader Tapped to Try to Form Government

text: An inmate who led authorities on an eight-day manhunt after escaping from an Orange County jail got his trial on kidnapping and torture charges delayed Tuesday as his lawyer raised concerns about his ability to find an unbiased jury to hear the case.
headline: Recaptured Jail Fugitive's Torture Trial Delayed

text: The political suspense isn't over now that the Iowa caucuses are history. There will be plenty of intrigue to track on the day after, too.
headline: The Day After the Big Day: What to Watch in NH and Beyond

text: The opening contest of the 2016 presidential election delivered an Iowa victory to hard-charging conservative Ted Cruz, humble pie to Donald Trump and a night of bristling suspense in a too-close-to-call contest between Democrats Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders.
headline: AP News Guide: Cruz Wins Iowa; Dem Race Up in Air

text: Donald Trump failed to live up to his own hype and finished second to Ted Cruz, but it was a late surge from Marco Rubio that may wind up the as the biggest surprise of the Iowa caucuses.
headline: Iowa Takeaways: Trump Can't Meet Hype, Clinton Underwhelms

text: You didn't have to win your party's caucus in Iowa on Monday night to look like and sound like a winner. Even winding up in third place could energize supporters.
headline: AP PHOTOS: Winners and Near-Winners of Iowa's Caucuses

text: The Cannes Film Festival has invited "Mad Max" director George Miller to preside over this year's jury and award the Palme d'Or for France's equivalent of the Oscars.
headline: 'Mad Max' Director Miller to Lead Cannes Film Festival Jury

text: The jailed leader of an armed group that took over an Oregon wildlife preserve struck a defiant tone Tuesday while again urging four holdouts to leave, saying local residents should control the federally owned property and U.S. officials do not belong there.
headline: Oregon Standoff Leader Strikes Defiant Tone From Behind Bars

text: Hillary Clinton tried to turn a skin-of-her-teeth victory in Iowa into a bit of momentum for her battered Democratic campaign, and Ted Cruz sought to lock in his spot at the top of the Republican field as the presidential candidates packed up Tuesday and sped to New Hampshire.
headline: Clinton Wins Iowa, Campaigns Turn to New Hampshire

text: Liverpool manager Juergen Klopp said he was aware of Leicester City's game plan ahead of Tuesday's trip to the King Power Stadium, but admitted that the knowledge, by itself, would not guarantee a result for his club.
headline: Liverpool's Klopp a Fan of Leicester's Playing Style

text: Syrian rebel group Jaish al-Islam denied on Tuesday a Russian defence ministry report that its jets had destroyed a stash of oil products belonging to them in areas they control in the eastern suburbs of the Syrian capital.
headline: Jaish Al Islam Rebel Group Denies Russia Hit Oil Stash

text: An international coalition is pushing back Islamic State militants in their Syrian and Iraqi strongholds, but the group is threatening Libya and could seize the nation's oil wealth, U.S Secretary of State John Kerry said on Tuesday.
headline: ISIS Pushed Back in Iraq, Syria, but a Threat in Libya: Kerry

text: Less than a month after its purported H-bomb test, North Korea announced Tuesday it is planning a rocket launch as soon as next week. Though speculation of a launch had been growing for about a week, experts say that with underground railways, giant tarps and a movable launch pad structure in place the North is getting a lot better at hiding its preparations.
headline: N. Korea, Planning Rocket Launch, Getting Better at Stealth

text: Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull on Tuesday raised the possibility of dissolving both houses of Parliament and calling an early election to break a political deadlock that has stymied the government, government officials aware of the matter said.
headline: Australian PM Turnbull Weighs Early Poll to Break Political Deadlock

text: The air traffic control system that choreographs the roughly 7,000 aircraft in U.S. skies at any given moment is the most complex, but also one of the safest, in the world — and rarely a thought in the minds of the millions of travelers who rely on it.
headline: Plan to Spin Off Air Traffic Control Generates Turbulence

text: The FBI has launched a Facebook page in Farsi to solicit tips on the whereabouts of Robert Levinson, a former FBI agent who went missing in Iran nine years ago.
headline: FBI Creates Facebook Page in Farsi for Case of Missing Agent

text: Nintendo Co. reported a 36 percent drop in quarterly profit on Tuesday after lackluster video game sales for the year-end holiday shopping season.
headline: Nintendo's Quarterly Profit Slips 36 Percent on Lower Sales

text: The Education Department's chief information officer collapsed Tuesday after undergoing grueling questioning from lawmakers about his work on side businesses with subordinates, failure to pay taxes on his profits and award of a government contract to a friend's company.
headline: US Education Official Apologizes for Judgment, Collapses

text: Can President Barack Obama and Republicans put aside years of ill will to secure a few big breakthroughs in Obama's final year? Don't get your hopes up.
headline: High Hopes, Wide Gulf as Obama, GOP Look for Common Ground

text: The top American commander in Afghanistan told lawmakers on Tuesday that the war is not a lost cause and underscored his optimism with a personal story about his son, an Army sergeant preparing for his third deployment to the war-torn country.
headline: Top US Commander Says War in Afghanistan Is Not a Lost Cause

text: In the refugee camp in eastern Lebanon where Fatima Khaled lives with her two daughters, only three children found a spot in the local school.
headline: Syrian Refugee Teachers Help Fill the Education Gap

text: UBS reported a surprise outflow of funds from its flagship wealth management business on Tuesday, overshadowing its best annual results since 2010 and a higher than expected dividend payout.
headline: UBS Wealth Management Outflows Take Shine Off Profit Jump

text: European Council President Donald Tusk set out a plan on Tuesday for keeping Britain in the European Union to a mixed reception which underlined the challenges Prime Minister David Cameron faces convincing Britons they should stay in the bloc.
headline: Tusk's Plan to Keep Britain in EU Draws Mixed Response

text: Georgia executed a 72-year-old man, its oldest death row inmate, early Wednesday for the killing of a convenience store manager during a robbery decades ago.
headline: Oldest Death Row Inmate in Georgia, Age 72, Is Executed

text: Steven Smith admitted that Usman Khawaja has the right to feel aggrieved after the Australia captain confirmed the in-form batsman had been overlooked for Wednesday's opening one-dayer against New Zealand.
headline: Smith Feels Sorry for Overlooked Khawaja in First ODI

text: The U.S. Department of Justice has requested additional information over British interdealer broker Tullett Prebon Plc's proposed acquisition ICAP Plc's voice broking business, the companies said on Tuesday.
headline: U.S. Justice Officials Seek Details on Tullett-ICAP Deal

text: A special war crimes tribunal in Bangladesh on Tuesday sentenced two more men to death after finding them guilty of killing, kidnapping and looting during the country's independence war against Pakistan in 1971.
headline: Bangladesh Sentences 2 More to Death in 1971 War Crimes

text: Donald Trump, the New York businessman seeking the Republican U.S. presidential nomination, said on Tuesday he felt "a tinge" of disappointment after losing to Texas Senator Ted Cruz in the Iowa caucuses.
headline: Trump: 'Tinge' of Sadness Over Losing Iowa

text: A former Malaysian law minister filed a legal suit Tuesday challenging a decision by the country's attorney general not to prosecute Prime Minister Najib Razak over a financial scandal involving more than $700 million channeled into his private bank accounts.
headline: Malaysian Ex-Minister Challenges Move Not to Charge Najib

text: Manager Arsene Wenger has urged Arsenal to "put things right" when they take on Southampton on Tuesday by avenging the 4-0 loss they suffered at St Mary's Stadium on Boxing Day.
headline: Wenger Out to Settle a Score as Arsenal Take on Southampton

text: Mediclinic International Plc, which is being created by the merger of Al Noor Hospitals Group and Mediclinic International Ltd, will be listed in London on Feb. 15, the chief executive of Al Noor said on Tuesday.
headline: Merged Al Noor/Mediclinic to List on Feb. 15, Eyes Gulf Expansion

text: Japan's Nintendo Co reported a 5.3 percent increase in third-quarter operating profit, in line with analysts forecasts, as lower costs helped offset a decline in overall sales.
headline: Lower Costs Nudge Nintendo's Third-Quarter Operating Profit 5.3 Percent Higher

text: Cam Newton became known for his on field celebrations during the Carolina Panthers march to Super Bowl 50, but the quarterback says preparation is what brings him real joy.
headline: Newton Shows Serious Side at Media Night

text: A teacher arrested in connection with the escape of three inmates from a Southern California jail was freed from custody on Monday after prosecutors said they did not have enough evidence to charge her with a crime.
headline: Teacher Arrested in Southern California Jail Escape Freed

text: British online grocer Ocado is confident it will sign multiple overseas technology deals despite missing out on its target of securing a first one in 2015, the firm said on Tuesday.
headline: Britain's Ocado Says Overseas Deals Will Come

text: Chinese shares ended higher on Tuesday, and the country's central bank guided the yuan to its highest daily fix in almost a month as Beijing sought to keep markets calm heading into the Lunar New Year holidays.
headline: China Shares End Higher, Yuan Fixed Firmer

text: BP's fourth-quarter earnings plunged 91 percent amid sharp declines in oil prices as the British energy company continued to make provision for the Deepwater Horizon disaster in the Gulf of Mexico and streamline operations.
headline: BP Reports 91 Percent Plunge in Fourth Quarter Earnings

text: Media Day was transformed into Opening Night for Super Bowl 50 but the switch to prime time did nothing to change the zany tone on Monday as super models and super heroes mingled with giants of sports journalism.
headline: Super Models, Super Heroes Add Up to Super Strange Media Day

text: A cyber attack on Britain's TalkTalk Telecom Group in October cost the company as much as 80 million pounds but fewer customers than feared opted to end their subscriptions.
headline: TalkTalk Lost More Than 100,000 Customers After Cyber Attack

text: PSA Peugeot Citroen will recall 2,484 Peugeot 4007 cars in Russia because of possible problems with their electronics systems, Russian state standards agency Rosstandart said on Tuesday.
headline: Peugeot to Recall 2,484 Cars in Russia Over Electronics Faults

text: British supermarket group Sainsbury's has agreed to buy Argos-owner Home Retail for 1.3 billion pounds, accelerating its growth strategy by creating the country's largest general merchandise retail business.
headline: Sainsbury's Bets on Argos Takeover for Digital Age

text: In a story Feb. 2 about California water conservation, The Associated Press reported erroneously that the average monthly water use declined from 76 gallons for each person in November to 67 gallons in December. The figures were for daily consumption, not monthly use.
headline: Correction: California Drought Story

text: BP slumped to its biggest annual loss last year and announced thousands more job cuts on Tuesday, showing that even one of the nimblest oil producers is struggling in the worst market downturn in over a decade.
headline: BP Reports Biggest Ever Annual Loss

text: When Cam Newton discovered the Carolina Panthers planned to make a run at signing Michael Oher last offseason, he texted the free agent offensive tackle: "I need you. I don't want you. I NEED you."
headline: Newton to Oher: 'I Need You' to Play in Carolina

text: The European Central Bank is working on a plan to allow consumers to transfer money using their phone numbers or email addresses rather than a complicated bank account number, a senior bank official said.
headline: ECB Plans System for Bank Transfers by Phone, Email-Report

text: When the NFL turned its anvil into a carrot, giving Von Miller a way out of its drug program, Denver's star linebacker was free to be himself this season — and was he ever.
headline: Miller's the Loose Leader of the Denver Broncos

text: National Australia Bank Ltd has delayed the float of Clydesdale Bank Plc by 24 hours to update its listing prospectus after a request for more information from a rating agency. Clydesdale, whose shares were priced at 180 pence on Monday,
headline: Australia's NAB Delays Clydesdale IPO After Ratings Question

text: Brandt Snedeker now has four PGA Tour victories in which he started at least five shots out of the lead in the final round. The Farmers Insurance Open followed the script of his previous comeback except for one big difference.
headline: A Perfect Storm Works Out Perfectly for Snedeker

text: Every Super Bowl kicks off with the hopes of a thrilling game, capped by a dramatic drive in which the champion seizes control to capture the Lombardi Trophy.
headline: From Montana to Manning: Superb Super Bowls Finishes

text: Until recently, Syrian refugee Eyad Zoulghena only had bad options.
headline: Scholarships, Tutoring to Save 'Lost Generation' of Syrians

text: Southampton manager Ronald Koeman is bracing for a revenge-minded Arsenal side when the Saints visit the Emirates Stadium for a Premier League clash on Tuesday.
headline: Saints Expect Arsenal to Come Out With All Guns Blazing

text: A Detroit-area police officer whose bloody beating of a motorist was captured on dashcam video was sentenced to at least 13 months in prison Tuesday, with the judge rebuking him for "Dirty Harry tactics" but still handing down a punishment significantly below the guidelines.
headline: Detroit-Area Officer Gets 13 Months in Prison for Assault

text: Texas Senator Ted Cruz was victorious in the first Republican nomination contest of the 2016 White House race, but there was another big winner in Iowa on Monday night: Florida Senator Marco Rubio and the Republican establishment.
headline: Marco Rubio Emerges as Champion of Battered Republican Establishment

text: Asian shares tumbled on Wednesday as oil prices dropped for a third day, prompting investors to seek shelter in safe-haven assets and lifting bonds and gold to multi-month highs.
headline: Asian Shares Fall, Safe Assets Shine as Oil Retreats

text: Led by a triumphant Aung San Suu Kyi, Myanmar is preparing to take a historic leap into uncharted territory, having only known democracy for 14 of its 1,000 years of recorded history. Suu Kyi, who scored a stunning victory in last year's elections, follows a procession of absolute monarchs, British colonial rulers and home-bred generals who are still standing tall in the wings.
headline: New Democratic Era Dawning in Myanmar

text: Many Ferguson residents expressed concern Tuesday that a settlement with the U.S. Department of Justice could financially ruin the St. Louis suburb where a police officer fatally shot 18-year-old Michael Brown.
headline: Ferguson Residents Worried About Cost of US-Mandated Changes

text: China has sentenced two men to death for the 2013 killing of a prominent Tibetan religious leader, state media said, in what had been one of Tibet's most closely watched murder cases.
headline: China Sentences Two Men to Death in Killing of Tibetan Religious Leader

text: It may be too close to call between Democratic presidential candidates Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders in the Iowa caucuses on Monday, but the senator from Vermont was the clear winner on social media.

text: Asian shares stumbled Wednesday as another steep drop in the price of oil reinforced worries about the potential impact on the world economy of job cuts and reduced investment in the energy industry.
headline: Asian Stocks Weighed Down by Another Oil Price Dive

text: The Taliban suicide bombing against a bus carrying employees of Afghanistan's biggest media company last month has shocked local journalists, who fear they are now in the cross hairs of an increasingly lethal insurgency.
headline: Afghan Taliban Open New Front in War With Attacks on Media

text: U.S. airstrikes have destroyed an Islamic State-operated radio station in a remote part of eastern Afghanistan, officials said Tuesday.
headline: Airstrikes Destroy IS Radio Station in Afghanistan

text: Index Ventures, an early investor in technology hits like Skype and Dropbox, is spinning off its biotech portfolio into a new $1 billion (695 million pounds) business, with backing from drug giants GlaxoSmithKline and Johnson & Johnson.
headline: GSK and J&J Back $1 Billion Biotech Spin-Off From Index Ventures

text: The handlers of Pennsylvania's most famous groundhog, Punxsutawney Phil, said the furry rodent failed to see his shadow at dawn Tuesday, meaning he "predicted" an early spring.
headline: Pennsylvania's Punxsutawney Phil 'Predicts' Early Spring

text: Jamie Weisner scored 25 points on 9-for-10 shooting to lead No. 9 Oregon State past No. 8 Arizona State 67-44 on Monday night in a matchup of the Pac-12 Conference's top teams.
headline: Weisner Leads Oregon St Women Past No. 8 Arizona St 67-44

text: Yahoo Inc's plans to turn around its struggling core business are set to dominate its earnings report on Tuesday, with investors keen to see if CEO Marissa Mayer will push ahead with a proposed spin-off or entertain calls for a complete sale.
headline: Spin-Off or Sale? Yahoo Turnaround Plan in Focus as Earnings Awaited

text: Rudy Gay had 32 points, nine rebounds and six assists as the Sacramento Kings snapped a five-game losing streak by defeating the Milwaukee Bucks 111-104 on Monday night.
headline: Gay Scores 32 to Lead Kings Over Bucks, 111-104

text: The parents of an unarmed black teenager killed by a white police officer four years ago Tuesday rallied at City Hall to demand the city fire the patrolman.
headline: Slain Teen's Parents Ask New York City Mayor to Fire Officer

text: A Taiwanese county has built an enormous glass shoe as a tribute to local women who suffered from a debilitating foot disease.
headline: Taiwan County Builds Huge Glass Shoe as Tribute to Women

text: Study your surroundings. Find exits. Identify makeshift weapons. Americans are gleaning those tips and others as they pack classes on how to react to and survive a shooting.
headline: Americans Are Packing Classes in How to Survive a Shooting

text: U.S. Senator Marco Rubio, emerging from the first presidential nominating contest in Iowa as the leading Republican mainstream contender, portrayed himself in New Hampshire on Tuesday as the party's best hope to recapture the White House.
headline: Marco Rubio Becomes Early Hope for Mainstream U.S. Republicans

text: U.S. Senator Marco Rubio, emerging from the first presidential nominating contest in Iowa as the leading Republican mainstream contender, portrayed himself in New Hampshire on Tuesday as the party's best hope to recapture the White House.
headline: Marco Rubio Becomes Early Hope for Mainstream U.S. Republicans

text: Three teenagers were arrested on Monday in connection with a shooting at a Seattle homeless encampment where two people were killed and three wounded, police said.
headline: Three Teenagers Arrested in Fatal Shooting at Seattle Homeless Camp

text: Oil futures extended losses into a third session in Asian trade on Wednesday, as U.S. crude stocks last week surged to more than half a billion barrels and as Iran plans to boost exports from March.
headline: Oil Futures Drop for 3rd Session on Rising Crude Stocks, Oversupply

text: A U.S. meat supplier is disputing a Chinese court's verdict that its local subsidiary sold expired chicken and beef to McDonald's, KFC and other fast food restaurants in China.
headline: US Firm in China Meat Scandal Disputes Court's Verdict

text: Gordon Hayward had 27 points and 12 rebounds, Rodney Hood added 19 points and the Utah Jazz beat the Chicago Bulls 105-96 in overtime on Monday night.
headline: Hayward Has 27 Points, 12 Rebounds as Jazz Beat Bulls in OT

text: Connor Lammert had 15 points, including a clutch 3-pointer in the final minute, and Texas won for the sixth time in its last seven games, beating No. 15 Baylor 67-59 on Monday night.
headline: Texas Upsets No. 15 Baylor 67-59 for 6th Win in 7 Games

text: Haiti's outgoing president has released a brash pop song jeering at his critics and aiming sexually suggestive lyrics at his main target, an award-winning female journalist.
headline: Song by Haiti's Outgoing Leader Jeers at Female Journalist

text: Today is Tuesday, Feb. 2, the 33rd day of 2016. There are 333 days left in the year. This is Groundhog Day.
headline: Today in History

text: Several missteps suggested that the candidate’s style of campaigning was not a good fit with the retail politics often rewarded in Iowa.
headline: 2nd-Place Finish Pierces Trump’s Mystique, but Another Chance Comes Quickly

text: The close vote means that Mrs. Clinton and Mr. Sanders are likely to split Iowa’s share of delegates to the Democratic convention.
headline: Little Separates Sanders and Clinton in Tight Race in Iowa

text: After months of campaigning, fierce debates and a blizzard of television commercials, polls showed how voters split among the presidential hopefuls when it came time to make a decision.
headline: Polls Show Preferences and Priorities in Iowa

text: Damion Lee scored 24 points, making two free throws with 8.3 seconds remaining, to help the No. 19 Cardinals, playing at home, upset the No. 2 Tar Heels.
headline: Louisville Ends North Carolina’s Streak at 12 Games

text: Only a handful of Democrats showed up to caucus in Indianola Precinct 7 four years ago, as President Obama sought re-election. This year, however, the race was far more competitive.
headline: With Eyes of the World on a School Cafeteria Caucus, the Lunch Lady Rules

text: Martin O’Malley, a former mayor of Baltimore and governor of Maryland, said Monday night that he would end his campaign for the Democratic nomination in the presidential election.

text: At a caucus site in Pella, Iowa, it was clear that the early arrivals included many first-time caucusgoers, with no unanimity about who they were supporting.

text: The victory by Senator Ted Cruz, powered by a surge of support from evangelical Christians, threw into question the depth of support for Donald J. Trump.

text: A Chinese court sentenced 10 employees of the OSI Group, which supplies McDonald’s and Yum Brands in China, to prison and fined the company over claims that it reused returned food products to avoid losses.

text: Tuck, a defensive end who helped the Giants win two Super Bowls and spent 11 seasons in the N.F.L., compiling 66½ sacks, said he was retiring.
headline: Tuck, Raider and Ex-Giant, Ends Career With Gratitude

text: Two art experts, including Mark Rothko’s son, Christopher, testified that the Knoedler gallery’s director misrepresented their opinions on works sold falsely as by artists like Rothko.

text: Reggie Jackson, who had been listed as questionable to play because of dehydration, battled through cramps to help Detroit defeat the Nets in Brooklyn.

text: Two Republican candidates, Chris Christie and John Kasich, could face virtual elimination if they fail to stand out in the New Hampshire primary next week.

text: Snedeker finished with a six-under-par 282 at the Farmers Insurance Open after winds toppled trees on the South Course and played havoc with scores.

text: The focus of the Grammy Fund will be lobbying Congress for fair compensation for creators of music.

text: The mayor requested the review after police officers fatally shot an African-American man on a city street in December, sparking protests.
headline: San Francisco Will Have U.S. Review Police Tactics

text: The arrest of two Virginia Tech students in the abduction and murder of a 13-year-old girl who posted on a Facebook group called Teen Dating and Flirting has set off fresh concerns about the dangers of young people who seek liaisons on social media.

text: President Obama plans to increase the deployment of heavy weapons and other equipment to NATO countries in Central and Eastern Europe.

text: Schneider, the team’s No. 1 goalie for a season and a half, has made it his mission to get the Devils, who have missed the playoffs in four of the past five years, to the postseason.
headline: Brodeur’s Successor Finds a Home and Is Helping the Devils Rebuild

text: A North Carolina case has implications for what voting-related laws federal courts might allow states to pursue and enforce.
headline: Closing Arguments Given in Key Voter Rights Trial

text: Laurence D. Fink of BlackRock urged 500 chief executives in a letter to stop providing quarterly earnings estimates.

text: The video, which appeared to show a Russian opposition figure in the cross hairs of a sniper’s rifle, was removed from Instagram because it violated guidelines against threats or harassment, a spokeswoman said.

text: Researchers said the Obama administration’s spending proposal was a comparatively small sum in a field in which major advances often take many billions to achieve.
headline: $1 Billion Planned for Cancer ‘Moonshot’

text: A group of 11 professors at U.C. Berkeley have objected to a quietly installed cybersecurity program set up by the University of California system in response to a huge data breach last summer.
headline: A New Digital Privacy Protest

text: Fugitives who had broken out of an Orange County jail argued over whether to kill a cabdriver they had kidnapped.
headline: Fight Between 2 California Escapees Proved to Be Turning Point

text: It may be a political football for presidential candidates, but the liveliest debate recently about the Trans-Pacific Partnership is among blue-ribbon economists.

text: Residents angry about the takeover of a federal wildlife refuge confronted antigovernment supporters in a nonviolent but emotional demonstration in Burns, Ore.
headline: Both Sides in Takeover Face Off in Oregon

text: A coming court hearing surrounding sexual assault charges against Bill Cosby is likely to pit a former district attorney in Montgomery County, Pa., against the county’s present district attorney.

text: More than 100 of the new lawmakers are, like the democracy leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, former political prisoners.
headline: First Freely Elected Parliament in Decades Opens in Myanmar

text: Reports released by the National Transportation Safety Board found no problems with the train, tracks or signals. Full findings are due in a few months.
headline: Human Error Possible in Deadly ’15 Amtrak Derailment, Documents Suggest

text: Settlements with Barclays and Credit Suisse for misrepresenting private stock trading sites are not likely to be the last cases involving abuses in electronic trading.

text: The ultimate anti-establishment White House candidate may be the one living there now, as the president’s success has emboldened candidates from both parties to try to follow his example.

text: After two one-year deals with CBS for “Thursday Night Football” games, the N.F.L. announced a two-year deal with CBS and NBC worth an estimated $450 million annually.

text: The Tidal streaming service says the album is a hit, but it opened relatively low on the Billboard chart, which disqualifies album copies that are part of gratis promotions.
headline: Rihanna’s New Album: Just How Big Is It?

text: Revenue increased 24 percent in the most recent quarter, positioning the outfit formerly known as Google to become the world’s most valuable company.
headline: In Earnings Debut, Google’s Parent Sets Itself Up to Pass Apple in Value

text: Greg Bird, who shined in 157 at-bats last season, will have a procedure to repair a torn labrum in his right shoulder after initially injuring it last spring.
headline: Yanks’ Top Prospect at First Base Will Miss Season After Surgery

text: José Tomás has been considered a kind of savior amid the dwindling spectacle that is bullfighting, but on Sunday, in front of more than 45,000 fans in Mexico City, he brought the bull in too close.
headline: A God of the Ring Made Human

text: Volkswagen Financial Services, the company’s in-house bank, has been an important element in VW’s rise to become the No. 2 carmaker in the world after Toyota.

text: Broncos punter Britton Colquitt always knew that he would get a Super Bowl ring someday. The only question is whether it'll be bequeathed to him or bestowed upon him.
headline: B. Colquitt Wants a SB Ring to Add to the Family Collection

text: The U.S. government has granted aid to workers at Alcoa Inc's Intalco aluminum smelter in Washington state, after they complained that Chinese dumping threatened their jobs, according to a federal ruling.
headline: U.S. Grants Aid to Alcoa Smelter Workers After China Complaint: Ruling

text: The U.S. Internal Revenue Service said on Wednesday it is experiencing computer failure across several systems and temporarily cannot accept many taxpayer returns.
headline: IRS Says Experiencing Computer Failure

text: Grammy-award winning pop star Taylor Swift is making her first foray into the world of mobile gaming by partnering with Glu Mobile Inc to develop a new game, the company said on Wednesday.
headline: Taylor Swift to Develop Mobile Game With Glu Mobile

text: A Michigan art dealer was arrested by the FBI on Wednesday for what authorities say was an extensive scheme to sell counterfeit works by renowned artists including Willem de Kooning.
headline: Michigan Art Dealer Arrested by FBI for Selling Forgeries

text: Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz is blocking President Barack Obama's nominees in the Senate — from up north, in New Hampshire.
headline: Capitol Hill Buzz: Cruz Disrupts Senate From Campaign Trail

text: U.S. law enforcement officials preparing for Super Bowl 50 have worked with their French counterparts to learn from last year's deadly attacks in Paris, as they plan safety for Sunday's big game, the Secretary of Homeland Security said on Wednesday.
headline: Super Bowl Security Plan Informed by Paris Attacks: U.S. Official

text: Slowing Chinese demand for sorghum is set to exacerbate tough market conditions for grain farmers in the United States and Australia, as one of the few bright spots in global markets over the past two years starts to fade.

text: Fresh from taking on the world in financial services, China's cashed-up banks are targeting a bigger slice of the surging global aviation market, beefing up affiliates bent on supplying planes to airlines around the planet.

text: Thai junta chief Prayuth Chan-ocha is relying increasingly on a security measure dubbed "the dictator's law" to push through unpopular policies and kickstart stalled reforms, say critics, who warn it could spark further opposition to military rule.
headline: Use of 'Dictator Law' Rises in Thailand as Junta's Reforms Falter

text: Mexico's health ministry on Wednesday sought to play down any impact on its tourism industry from the mosquito-borne Zika virus, emphasizing the disease was under control and far from its main tourist centres.
headline: Mexico Health Ministry Downplays Zika Threat to Tourism

text: Pennsylvania prosecutors can put disgraced comedian Bill Cosby on trial for charges of sexually assaulting a woman more than a decade ago, Common Pleas Court Judge Steven O'Neill ruled on Wednesday.
headline: Pennsylvania Officials Can Prosecute Cosby for Sex Assault: Judge

text: U.S. gun traders are setting up new websites to arrange deals after Facebook Inc barred private gun sales on its platform.
headline: U.S. Gun Traders Rush to Set Up New Sites After Facebook Firearms Ban

text: Authorities say a 23-year-old snowmobiler was killed in an avalanche near Wolf Creek Pass in southern Colorado.
headline: Snowmobiler Killed in Avalanche in Colorado

text: United Nations Syria peace mediator Staffan de Mistura suspended peace talks between the government and rebels due to the Russian military escalation, which is aimed at humiliating the opposition, a senior U.N. official said on Wednesday.
headline: Envoy Suspended Syria Talks Over Russian Escalation: U.N. Official

text: Top seed Richard Gasquet comfortably reached the quarterfinals of the Open Sud de France by beating Ernests Gulbis of Latvia 6-4, 6-4, while second-seeded Marin Cilic went out to lowly ranked Alexander Zverev 7-6 (4), 7-6 (1) on Wednesday.
headline: Gasquet Reaches Montpellier Quarterfinals as Cilic Goes Out

text: Will preppy ever go out of style? Not if Tommy Hilfiger can help it.
headline: Tommy Hilfiger Puts Out Prep Aimed at Younger Set

text: Napoli maintained their two-point advantage at the top of Serie with a 2-0 victory at Lazio on Wednesday in a game suspended due to racist chanting as Juventus beat Genoa 1-0 to break a club record for consecutive league wins in a single season.
headline: Napoli Stay Top After Game Suspended for Racist Chanting

text: Weatherford International Plc said it would cut about 6,000 jobs in the first half of 2016 as a steep drop in oil prices hurts drilling and exploration activity.
headline: Oilfield Services Provider Weatherford to Cut 6,000 Jobs

text: Surprise leaders Leicester City face a severe test of their Premier League title credentials over the next 10 days, starting with Saturday's trip to Manchester City.
headline: Intrepid Leicester Face Start of Crunch Time

text: A former Rutgers University student convicted of using a webcam to spy on a roommate who later killed himself likely will have to wait a few months to find out whether a state appeals will order his 30-day jail sentence invalidated or lengthened or will send him back for a new trial.
headline: University Webcam Spy Case Ruling Expected in 3-4 Months

text: GoPro Inc forecast current-quarter revenue well below analysts' estimates on weak demand for its wearable cameras and the company named Brian McGee as its new chief financial officer.
headline: GoPro Forecasts Revenue Below Estimates, Names New CFO

text: Ford Motor Company is conducting tests at one of its Detroit-area facilities after finding vinyl chloride in groundwater outside the plant.
headline: Ford Conducting Tests After Chemical Found Outside Plant

text: The United States has recently rejected 30 Syrians out of thousands seeking to enter the country, Obama administration officials told a congressional panel on Wednesday, as the United States tightens vetting of immigrants and other visitors following attacks in California and Paris.

text: The United Nations strongly criticised on Thursday an Australian court ruling that paves the way for the deportation of dozens of Australian-born infants to an offshore immigration camp, while church leaders offered sanctuary to asylum seekers on the list.
headline: Churches Offer Sanctuary as U.N. Criticises Australian Asylum Policy

text: Apple Inc must pay VirnetX Holding Corp more than $625 million for using the patent licensing company's Internet security technology without permission in its FaceTime and iMessage features, a federal jury in Texas said on Wednesday.

text: Florida Governor Rick Scott declared a public health emergency in four counties with travel-related cases of the Zika virus on Wednesday, and ordered state officials to increase mosquito control efforts in some of the most populous parts of the state.

text: A Mexican court has issued an injunction blocking further work on a real estate project in the Caribbean coast resort of Cancun that activists say has almost killed a mangrove swamp at the site.

text: An Italian student from Britain's Cambridge University who went missing last week in Cairo is likely dead, the Italian foreign ministry said on Wednesday.
