text: Berlin police had a previous lead that the German capital could be the target of an attack when conducting raids on Thursday in a search for men suspected of links to Islamic State militants, a spokesman said.
headline: Berlin Police Can't Confirm Landmarks Were Targeted for Attack

text: Italy will send a team specialized in treating war wounded to Iraq as it prepares to send troops to guard Mosul dam maintenance workers, Defence Minister Roberta Pinotti said on Thursday.
headline: Italy to Send 130 Military Personnel to Iraq to Recover Wounded

text: Viacom Inc's board of directors named Chief Executive Officer Philippe Dauman as executive chairman, replacing majority owner Sumner Redstone, overriding calls for an independent board chief from Redstone's daughter, who voted against Dauman.
headline: Viacom Names CEO Dauman as Chair as Redstone Exits; Daughter Protests

text: Sweden's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday that a United Nations panel had ruled that Wikileaks founder Julian Assange had been "arbitrarily detained".
headline: Swedish Foreign Ministry Confirms U.N. Report Says Assange Arbitrarily Detained

text: Authorities say a 23-year-old man fell to his death on Southern California's Mount Baldy when he reached out his hand to save a friend who had slipped while hiking.
headline: Hiker Falls to Death Trying to Help Friend on Mount Baldy

text: The United States and its allies conducted 22 air strikes against Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria on Wednesday, focusing primarily on the Iraqi towns of Qayyarah, Mosul and Ramadi, the U.S. military said in a statement on Thursday.
headline: U.S., Allies Conduct 22 Strikes Against Islamic State: U.S. Military

text: Nigeria's state oil company lost 267 billion naira ($1.3 billion) in 2015, even as it tried to pump more oil to counter slashed world prices, the Nigerian National Petroleum Corp. said Thursday.
headline: Nigerian State Petroleum Company Lost $1.3 Billion in 2015

text: State police say the driver of an SUV crossed the center line of a southern New Jersey highway and collided with an oncoming school bus, causing the bus to overturn.
headline: Motorist Dead, 5 Injured in SUV-School Bus Crash

text: An initial inquiry into a clinical drug trial that left one person dead and five others hospitalised in France last month found that the laboratory conducting the tests was slow to react when the first patient fell ill.
headline: Lab Criticised as Slow to Act in Fatal French Drug Trial

text: Few central bank chiefs have been jailed by a dictator or hide a loaded pistol in their desk draw, should Islamist militants decide to call. Bashir Issa Ali has done all that, and now he wants to recreate Somalia's currency from scratch.
headline: Somali Central Bank Chief Seeks New Currency to Rebuild Nation

text: The second of three men accused of plotting to use a drone to fly drugs, pornography and other contraband into a maximum-security state prison pleaded guilty Thursday to three misdemeanors involving tobacco, rolling papers and a cellphone.
headline: 2nd Suspect Pleads Guilty to Minor Counts Over Prison Drone

text: A man accused of killing a former Dutch health minister admitted the slaying at a court hearing Thursday, claiming it was an "order from God" because she was responsible for the Netherlands' euthanasia law.
headline: Man Admits Killing Dutch Ex-Minister Over Euthanasia Law

text: Barclays Plc has agreed to hand internal documents over to British prosecutors, potentially ending a drawn-out investigation into a 2008 fundraising involving Middle Eastern investors, Bloomberg reported on Thursday.
headline: Barclays to Hand Qatar Deal Documents Over to UK's SFO-Bloomberg

text: A teenager's cruel death three years ago has become a symbol of gender violence and South Africa's continued struggle to curb sexual violence.
headline: Teen's Death 3 Years Ago a Symbol of S. Africa's Rape Crisis

text: Continental Automotive Systems said on Thursday it supplied potentially defective air bag control units to 5 million vehicles used by Honda, Fiat Chrysler, Mercedes-Benz, and three other manufacturers built over a five-year period worldwide, widening an air bag safety crisis.Continental Automotive, a unit of Germany-based Continental AG, told the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration that electronic systems built from 2006 through 2010 and used in 5 million vehicles may fail and air bags may not deploy in a crash or may inadvertently deploy without warning.
headline: Continental Says Five Million Vehicles Worldwide May Have Faulty Air Bags

text: The U.S. embassy in Prague on Thursday blasted a decision by the Czech Republic's justice minister not to extradite a Lebanese national to the U.S. to face weapons charges.
headline: US Embassy Condemns Czechs for Not Extraditing Suspects

text: Russia plans to reduce troop numbers at its military base in Tajikistan, a Russian defense ministry spokesman said on Thursday, another move that suggests its political influence in the Central Asian country and wider region may be waning.
headline: Russia to Cut Troop Levels in Tajikistan Amid Questions About Its Influence

text: U.S. Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson said he intends to continue campaigning through the Republican National Convention in July after a report on Thursday said he planned a major downsizing of his flagging campaign.
headline: Republican Carson Cuts Staff but Vows to Campaign On

text: The man accused of murdering retired Dutch politician Els Borst confessed to her killing in court on Thursday, claiming he was motivated by her role in legalising euthanasia.
headline: Dutch Politician's Killer Cites Her Pro-Euthanasia Stance

text: Bosnia should publish the results of a contested population census carried out in 2013, a European Union-led monitoring body said on Thursday, as the Balkan nation prepares to apply to join the EU this month.
headline: EU-Led Monitors Urge Bosnia to Publish Results of 2013 Census

text: Spain's next government must ensure its budget deficit is reduced this year in line with European Union rules, the EU's Economics Commissioner Pierre Moscovici said on Thursday.
headline: Spain Has to Cut Deficit in 2016, Moscovici Says

text: Market expectations for euro exchange rates over the next three months flipped on Thursday into positive territory for the first time since 2012, a headache for euro zone officials hoping for a boost to growth from a weaker currency.
headline: Speculators Veer Toward Stronger Euro in Headache for ECB

text: Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif called on Thursday for U.N.-mediated Syrian peace talks to resume after they were suspended on Wednesday and for an immediate ceasefire.
headline: Iran's Zarif Calls for Syria Talks to Resume

text: It has no windows — but offers unrestricted views of Armageddon.
headline: The Strangelove Suite: Northern Ireland Sells Nuclear Bunker

text: New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie says his Republican presidential rival Marco Rubio isn't qualified to be president and is vowing to continue his campaign regardless of the outcome of the New Hampshire primary.
headline: Christie Vows to Continue Beyond New Hampshire

text: Tribune Publishing, the troubled owner of the Chicago Tribune and other newspapers around the country, said it received a $44.4 million cash infusion from a Chicago investor who has a stake in its rival newspaper the Chicago Sun-Times.
headline: Tribune Publishing Gets $44.4M From Chicago Investor

text: Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu called on Thursday for the United States to take a more decisive stance against Russia over its intervention in Syria.
headline: Turkey Calls for More Decisive U.S. Stance Against Russia Over Syria Intervention

text: Poland's relaunch of an official investigation into the 2010 plane crash in Russia that killed the country's president and a score of other officials is a sovereign right of Poland, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said on Thursday.
headline: Russia: Relaunch of Probe Into 2010 Polish Presidential Plane Crash Is 'Poland's Right'

text: French President Francois Hollande has dug himself into a hole over plans to strip dual nationals of their French passports if they are convicted of terrorism, and a looming government reshuffle is unlikely to help him regain lost popularity.
headline: Analysis-'Turning Gold Into Lead': Hollande Squanders Post-Attack Bounce

text: Those helping support the regime of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad are committing war crimes, Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu said on Thursday.
headline: Turkish PM Says Those Helping Assad Are Committing War Crimes

text: An ex-New Orleans police officer who burned the body of a man shot to death by a fellow officer in the chaos following Hurricane Katrina had his 17-year-sentenced reduced by more than five years Thursday by a federal judge.
headline: 5 Years Trimmed From Ex-Cop's Sentence in Katrina Body Case

text: Indian IT services exports are likely to grow at a slower pace next fiscal year than in the recent past as global clients rein in technology spending, an industry lobby group said on Thursday.
headline: India's IT Services Growth Seen Slowing as Clients Curb Spending

text: West Ham United's sole focus should be on their upcoming Premier League clash against an in-form Southampton side on Saturday and not on their promising league position of sixth, manager Slaven Bilic said on Thursday.
headline: West Ham Have to Focus on Saints Clash, Not League Table-Bilic

text: Russians Ilya Atnabaev and Denis Kekhter have been given four-year doping bans, the International Weightlifting Federation said on its website www.iwf.net on Thursday.
headline: Russian Weightlifters Given Four-Year Doping Bans

text: A phone call from Stevie Wonder changed Andra Day's life. He called Day and asked if he could work with her.
headline: Singer Andra Day Rises as Soul Songstress

text: Standard & Poor's downgraded commodities trader and miner Glencore's credit rating on Thursday, citing a slump in commodities prices and uncertainty about metals demand.
headline: S&P Cuts Glencore's Credit Rating, Outlook Stable

text: U.S. civil rights activist DeRay McKesson, who was instrumental in the growth of the Black Lives Matter movement against police violence, is running for mayor of Baltimore.
headline: Civil Rights Activist DeRay McKesson Running for Mayor of Baltimore

text: Tunisia on Thursday lifted the curfew imposed last month in response to sometimes violent demonstrations against unemployment in the country.
headline: Tunisia Lifts Curfew Imposed After Unemployment Unrest

text: Russia has serious grounds to suspect Turkey of preparing for a military incursion in Syria, where Russian jets are bombing rebel and jihadi fighters, Defence Ministry spokesman Igor Konashenkov said on Thursday.
headline: Russia Says It Suspects Turkey of Preparing Incursion in Syria

text: The Latest on WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange and impending finding by a U.N. body on his detention (all times local):
headline: The Latest: UN: Sweden Informed Last Month on Assange

text: ConocoPhillips slashed its quarterly dividend for the first time in at least 25 years and further lowered its capital budget for 2016 as a relentless fall in crude oil prices took its toll on the largest U.S. independent oil company.
headline: Conoco Cuts Dividend for First Time in 25 Years on Crude Crash

text: Authorities say a 40-year-old man has been caught trying to smuggle prescription drugs into an upstate New York jail in his prosthetic leg after being arrested for assaulting his girlfriend.
headline: Cops: Jailed NY Man Hid Prescription Drugs in Prosthetic Leg

text: Ireland's political system emerged from the rubble of the anti-British 1916 Easter Rising, and the parties contesting this month's election in its centenary year are battling to claim the legacy of the rebellion.
headline: Irish Election Hopefuls Spar Over Century-Old Uprising

text: Ralph Lauren Corp and Kohl's Corp warned of a tough year ahead after reporting disappointing holiday-quarter sales on Thursday, leading investors to dump their stocks and dragging down shares of several other retailers.
headline: Weak Sales at Kohl's, Ralph Lauren Spark Selloff in Retailers

text: A London-based trader accused of helping cause the 2010 Wall Street "flash crash" was operating a legitimate trading strategy rather than placing bogus orders to spoof the market, a British court heard on Thursday.
headline: U.S. Accuses London Trader of Helping Cause 2010 'Flash Crash'

text: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits rose more than expected last week, suggesting some loss of momentum in the labor market amid a sharp economic slowdown and stock market selloff.
headline: Rising U.S. Layoffs Hint at Ebbing Labor Market Momentum

text: WASHINGTON - U.S. nonfarm productivity fell in the fourth quarter at its fastest pace in more than a year, leading to a jump in labor-related production costs.
headline: U.S. Productivity Falls Sharply in Fourth Quarter

text: Saudi Arabian Airlines (Saudia), said a bomb scare that grounded its Riyadh-bound flight from Madrid on Thursday was a false alarm.
headline: Saudia Airlines Says Bomb Threat on Madrid-Riyadh Flight Is a Hoax

text: Iran and Russia have initialed contracts worth around $40 billion, including for power-engineering and railway projects, Russian news agencies quoted Ali Akbar Velayati, top adviser to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, as saying on Thursday.
headline: Khamenei's Top Aide Says Tehran, Moscow Ink $40 Billion in Projects: Agencies

text: U.S. productivity fell sharply in the final three months of 2015, closing out a fifth straight year of weak gains in worker efficiency.
headline: US Productivity Fell at Sharp 3 Percent Rate in Q4

text: More Americans sought unemployment benefits last week, but applications stayed near historically low levels in a positive sign for the job market.
headline: Applications for US Jobless Aid Rise, but Levels Still Low

text: An Israeli court jailed two Jewish youths on Thursday, one for life and the other for 21 years, for the murder of a Palestinian teenager in Jerusalem, a crime that helped trigger the 2014 Gaza war.
headline: Israeli Teenagers Get Long Jail Terms for Palestinian Youth's Murder

text: The outlook for business investment in Britain could be affected by how campaigning around the country's European Union membership referendum unfolds, Bank of England Governor Mark Carney said on Thursday.
headline: EU Referendum Campaigning Could Affect Business Investment-Carney

text: Country legend Merle Haggard has canceled his shows in February due to health issues caused by pneumonia in both lungs.
headline: Country Legend Merle Haggard Cancels February Shows

text: The boards of India, England and Australia will no longer be permanent members of the International Cricket Council's decision-making executive committee, the governing body said on Thursday.
headline: ICC Blow for India, England, Australia

text: There has been a flurry of activity and speculation in the case of Julian Assange, the outspoken WikiLeaks founder who has been squirreled away inside the Ecuadorean Embassy in London for more than three years to avoid questioning by Swedish authorities about sexual misconduct allegations.
headline: AP EXPLAINS: The Significance of Julian Assange's Case

text: Another problem has developed with automotive air bags, and this one will bring recalls of up to 5 million vehicles worldwide.
headline: Automakers to Recall 5M Vehicles for Another Air Bag Problem

text: Turkey returned its ambassador to the Vatican on Thursday, nearly 10 months after withdrawing him in protest against Pope Francis' description of the century-old massacres of Christian Armenians as genocide.
headline: Turkey Reinstates Vatican Envoy After Row Over Pope's Armenian Remarks

text: Mervyn King, who headed the Bank of England as the country suffered one of its biggest-ever economic downturns, is about to take his turnaround skills to another ailing institution: soccer club Aston Villa.
headline: Former BoE Boss King, Specialist in Crisis Management, Joins Villa Board

text: Crises at home and turmoil on world markets may have taken the shine off London's luxury property market for Chinese, Russian and Middle Eastern investors: some are even looking to sell up.
headline: Crises Spoil Chinese, Russian Appetite for Luxury London Property

text: Britain's financial regulator will broaden the scope of new rules that make bank employees more accountable for their actions by including high-speed traders and staff who handle their trading software, it said on Thursday
headline: British Watchdog Brings High-Speed Traders Under Accountability Net

text: The European Commission said on Thursday it had cleared Western Digital's planned acquisition of SanDisk after concluding that the takeover would not harm competition in the data storage market in Europe.
headline: EU Clears Western Digital Acquisition of SanDisk

text: A judge refused on Thursday to dismiss a rape charge against a former Oklahoma Highway Patrolman accused of assaulting three women during traffic stops, rejecting defense claims that the contact was consensual.
headline: Judge Refuses to Dismiss Rape Charge Against Ex-Trooper

text: Police in Thailand's capital said Thursday they have identified a man whose body parts were found floating in the city's Chao Phraya River as a Spanish consultant, and also have identified suspects in his killing.
headline: Thai Police: Slain Spanish Man ID'd From Body Parts in River

text: Russia said on Thursday it suspected Turkey was preparing a military incursion into Syria, as a Syrian army source said Aleppo would soon be encircled by government forces with Russian air support.
headline: Russia and Turkey Trade Accusations Over Syria

text: IBM's efforts to bolster its cloud offerings could get a boost from new developer tools it is unveiling on Thursday.
headline: IBM Tries to Bolster Cloud Growth With Developer Tools

text: Airport officials say two tires under the left wing of an airplane blew out during a landing at a Pennsylvania airport.
headline: Officials: 2 Plane Tires Blow Out on Landing in Pennsylvania

text: China's yuan will chip away at the U.S. dollar's dominance over the next decade but is unlikely to supplant it as the world's top currency, says a report from a federal watchdog.
headline: Report: China's Yuan to Erode, Not End, Dollar's Dominance

text: Russia reiterated on Thursday that its warplanes had not violated Turkish airspace and such accusations served as a cover-up for Ankara's increased military activity on the Syrian border.
headline: Russia Says Turkish Accusations Are Cover Up for Military Activity on Syrian Border

text: Red Cross said on Thursday it had delivered food for more than 12,000 people to the besieged Syrian town of Mouadamiya near Damascus, enough for only three weeks and that regular access was needed.
headline: Red Cross Delivers Food, Medicine to Besieged Syrian Town

text: Ireland's senior coalition party Fine Gael would use a quarter of the additional 10 billion euros it estimates will be available during the next government's five-year term on tax cuts if it is re-elected later this month, it said on Thursday.
headline: Irish PM Outlines Economic Plan as Support Dips

text: Philip Morris International's fourth-quarter performance was mixed as it dealt with some higher costs and lower cigarette shipment volume. The seller of Marlboro and other cigarette brands outside the United States also gave a 2016 profit forecast below analysts' estimates.
headline: Philip Morris Int'l Results Mixed, Outlook Disappoints

text: The Belgian who led the Nov. 13 attacks on Paris bragged that he slipped into France with a group of 90 extremists from Europe and the Middle East, according to testimony from the woman who tipped police to his location.
headline: Paris Attack Leader Said He Slipped in With 90 Extremists

text: Bank of England Governor Mark Carney and some of his fellow policymakers are answering questions after the central bank cut its growth and inflation forecasts in its latest inflation report and voted unanimously to keep interest rates on hold.
headline: Highlight-Bank of England Policymakers Speak After Inflation Report

text: Authorities say a man is dead following a shootout with Florida deputies during a brief standoff outside an Ocala gas station.
headline: Suspect Killed, Deputy Wounded During Standoff

text: Atlantic City council members can no longer use city-owned vehicles following questions about their necessity and cost.
headline: Atlantic City Council Members Banned From Using City Cars

text: Former world number one Lee Westwood wants to focus fully on his golf again this season after being distracted by a painful split from wife Laurae in 2015.
headline: Westwood Fully Focused on Golf Again After Marriage Breakdown

text: Lindsey Vonn left the finish area with plenty of complaints about the state of the Kandahar course and thinking she still had the fastest time in Thursday's training for a World Cup downhill.
headline: Lindsey Vonn Has Complaints About Downhill Course

text: Five Czechs who had been missing and presumed kidnapped in Lebanon for five months arrived home on Thursday after the Prague government freed two Lebanese nationals who were wanted by the United States.
headline: Czechs Release Two Lebanese as Missing Czechs Return From Lebanon, U.S. 'Shocked'

text: Run-DMC will open up for the Red Hot Chili Peppers at a pre-Super Bowl concert in San Francisco.
headline: Run-DMC to Open for Chili Peppers at Pre-Super Bowl Concert

text: Traumatized by months of fighting between security forces and Kurdish militants which has killed hundreds, Turkey's southeast suffered an economic blow on Thursday as a major hydropower project in the region was suspended due to security concerns.
headline: Conflict-Hit Southeast Turkey Dealt Fresh Blow as Power Project Shelved

text: Britain's energy regulator said on Thursday it has started gathering information about E.ON's practices in gaining new customers through a partnership with charity Age UK, following a request from the energy minister.
headline: UK Energy Watchdog Starts Probe of E.ON-Age UK Partnership

text: Passengers on a jet set to leave Madrid for Saudi Arabia were evacuated Thursday after the pilot reported an unspecified threat that authorities later determined was a hoax.
headline: Spain: Jet Evacuated in Madrid After Hoax Threat

text: Russia will spare no effort to ensure that a pause in the Syria peace talks held in Geneva is as short as possible, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said on Thursday.
headline: Russia Says Will Try Ensure Pause in Syria Talks 'as Short as Possible'

text: The world's biggest reinsurer Munich Re raised its dividend by more than expected, returning cash to shareholders that it cannot profitably invest in its business.
headline: Munich Re Raises Dividend on Stable Net Profit

text: Countries where Syrian refugees seek asylum should end harsh policies on registration, deportation and education that violate fundamental rights, Human Rights Watch (HRW) said on Thursday as donors met in London.
headline: Reforms Needed in Countries Taking Syrian Refugees: HRW Rights Group

text: Morocco's King Mohammed VI unveiled one of the world's biggest solar plants Thursday, taking advantage of the Sahara sunshine and a growing global push for renewable energy.
headline: Morocco Unveils Massive Solar Plant

text: The European Union pledged on Thursday to contribute over 3 billion euros ($3.36 billion) this year to support Syria as well as Jordan, Lebanon and Turkey, the countries bearing the brunt of the refugee crisis caused by the Syrian civil war.
headline: EU Pledges Over 3 Billion Euros to Syria and Region This Year: Tusk

text: Scotland have recalled flanker John Barclay for their opening Six Nations championship game against England at Murrayfield on Saturday.
headline: Scotland Recall Barclay for Six Nations Opener

text: U.S Secretary of State John Kerry pledged a total of around $890 million in aid for Syria and neighboring countries at a donor conference on Thursday and said he was in talks with his Russian counterpart about increasing humanitarian access to the country.
headline: U.S. Pledges About $890 Million at Syria Aid Conference

text: Much-travelled defender Gabriel Tamas has returned to Steaua Bucharest in an attempt to resurrect his career which has been blighted by his off-field partying and drinking problems.
headline: Tamas Back to Steaua to Rekindle Happy Days

text: Dancer Benjamin Millepied, who choreographed for the 2010 movie "Black Swan" and is married to its star, Natalie Portman, announced Thursday he's stepping down as dance director at Paris' premier ballet company.
headline: 'Black Swan' Choreographer Quits Paris Ballet Amid Tensions

text: Poland's government opened a new investigation Thursday into the 2010 plane crash in Russia that killed President Lech Kaczynski, with the defense minister saying that evidence pointing to Russian involvement was covered up in an earlier probe.
headline: Poland Reopens Probe Into 2010 Crash That Killed President

text: In this photo by Bullit Marquez, riot police use their shields to cover themselves from a slight drizzle as protesters rally at the U.S. Embassy in Manila, Philippines, to mark the 117th anniversary of the Philippine-American War. Carrying banners reading "Junk EDCA," the protesters are demanding the abolition of the Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement after the country's Supreme Court upheld the agreement's constitutionality, effectively allowing American forces, ships and planes to temporarily station in Philippine military camps. The U.S. military shut its local bases in 1992, ending almost a century of U.S. military presence in the Philippines, and opponents of the defense agreement see it as infringing on Philippine sovereignty.
headline: Image of Asia: Rally on Philippine-American War Anniversary

text: Donald Trump's plane was diverted to the Nashville International Airport after the control tower received a report that the plane was experiencing engine trouble.
headline: Donald Trump's Plane Makes Emergency Landing in Nashville

text: England winger Chris Ashton has lost his appeal against a 10-week ban for eye-gouging that has ruled him out of the Six Nations championship, European Professional Club Rugby said on Thursday.
headline: England Winger Ashton Loses Appeal Against 10-Week Ban

text: A jump in materials shares helped U.S. stocks eke out a second straight day of gains on Thursday, though disappointing forecasts from retailers and anxiety ahead of Friday's jobs report limited the advance.
headline: U.S. Stocks Rise for Second Day; Materials a Boost

text: A Lebanese airport official says five Czechs who went missing in eastern Lebanon in July have boarded a flight back to their homeland.
headline: Five Czechs Going Home After Missing in Lebanon for 7 Months

text: Former NBA All-Star Jayson Williams, who served more than a year in prison for the 2002 accidental shooting death of a limo driver, has been charged with drunken driving after he crashed his vehicle in upstate New York.
headline: Ex-NBA All-Star Jayson Williams Charged With Drunken Driving

text: An international donor conference in London has received pledges totaling of around $10 billion by 2020 to help the millions of Syrians displaced by civil war and neighboring countries struggling with the refugee crisis.
headline: A Glance at Which Countries Are Pledging What for Syrians

text: Poland's new government relaunched an inquiry on Thursday into the death of President Lech Kaczynski in a plane crash in Russia in 2010, a move likely to strain Warsaw's relations with its former overlord, already fragile over the Ukraine crisis.
headline: Poland Relaunches Inquiry Into 2010 Presidential Jet Crash in Russia

text: British clothing retailer Marks & Spencer said it has teamed up with model and TV presenter Alexa Chung on a fashion collection, seeking to repeat the success it enjoyed last year when Chung was photographed wearing one of its skirts.
headline: M&S Teams Up With Fashion Pundit Alexa Chung

text: A northwestern Alabama deputy and a suspect have both been wounded after a shootout in Florence.
headline: Alabama Deputy Shot While Serving Papers; Suspect Also Shot

text: Spanish authorities evacuated all passengers and crew from a flight bound for Riyadh at Madrid's Barajas international airport on Thursday after a bomb threat, which the airline later said was a hoax.
headline: Passengers, Crew Evacuated From Madrid-Riyadh Flight After Bomb Hoax

text: Germany's top-selling Bild newspaper reported that raids earlier on Thursday were linked to a possible plan for Islamist militants to attack Alexanderplatz in central Berlin, a busy transport hub where the famous television tower is located.
headline: Germany's Bild Says Raids Linked to Possible Plot in Central Berlin

text: Jack Riley, the Army coach who in 1960 guided the U.S. to its first Olympic gold medal in hockey, has died. He was 95.
headline: Jack Riley, US Hockey Coach at 1960 Olympics, Dies at 95

text: Former U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder is leading negotiations for MTN as the South Africa-based telecommunications giant tries to eliminate or reduce a $3.9 billion fine imposed against the company's Nigerian subsidiary, the Nigerian Communications Commission said Thursday.
headline: Former US Attorney General Eric Holder Negotiating MTN Fine

text: Police say a Connecticut man shaved his head and took weight loss pills to convince people he had stage 3 brain cancer and collect thousands in donations.
headline: Police: Man Faked Brain Cancer, Took Thousands in Donations

text: A plan to rein in New York City's horse-drawn carriages, a long-time Central Park tourist attraction, has collapsed after the labor union that helped negotiate the deal withdrew its support, Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Thursday.
headline: New York Deal on Horse-Drawn Carriages Collapses in Blow to Mayor

text: A 7-year-old Syrian girl suffering from a rare form of eye cancer arrived in Italy on Thursday, the first of an estimated 1,000 refugees who are being brought here on humanitarian grounds in a pilot project aimed at dissuading people from embarking on deadly sea crossings.
headline: Syrian Family Arrives in Italy in First Humanitarian Airlift

text: Iran will continue to develop its missile program and it should not be considered a threat to neighboring and friendly countries, the semi-official Fars news agency quoted the head of the army as saying on Thursday.
headline: Iran to Strengthen Missile Program: Army Chief

text: The Bank of England cut its growth forecasts on Thursday and the only policymaker who had been pushing for a rate hike reversed his position, suggesting rates will stay on hold for the foreseeable future.
headline: Bank of England Cuts Growth Outlook, Rate Hike a Distant Prospect

text: An anti-abortion activist indicted for using a fake driver's license ID to aid secret filming inside Planned Parenthood facilities turned himself into authorities in Houston on Thursday and was offered a probation deal, prosecutors said.
headline: Texas Prosecutor Offers Probation to Anti-Abortion Activist Behind Video

text: Afghanistan expects to restart peace talks with the Taliban within six months, chief executive Abdullah Abdullah said on Thursday, pinning hopes on factions within the Islamist militant group he said might be ready to give up violence.
headline: Afghanistan's Abdullah Expects Talks With Taliban in Months

text: The likelihood that the Bank of England will raise interest rates in coming months receded on Thursday, after the bank cut its economic forecasts due to the slowdown in global growth and market turmoil.
headline: Chance of UK Rate Increase Fades Amid Global Uncertainty

text: Villagers from two major ethnic groups in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo clashed with machetes and batons before dispersing when army troops and U.N. peacekeepers intervened and fired into the air, a U.N. spokesman said.
headline: Congo, U.N. Troops Fire in Air to Stop Clash Between Machete-Armed Villagers

text: Infuriating members of Congress, a smirking Martin Shkreli took the Fifth at a Capitol Hill hearing Thursday when asked about his jacking up of drug prices, then promptly went on Twitter and insulted his questioners as "imbeciles."
headline: Drug Exec Takes the Fifth on Capitol Hill, Angers Lawmakers

text: Britain's BBC said Matt LeBlanc, former star of 1990s U.S. hit comedy "Friends", will join the new presenting line-up for its popular car show "Top Gear" when it returns in May.
headline: Matt LeBlanc Joins BBC's 'Top Gear'

text: Valencia coach Gary Neville, pained by a 7-0 mauling at Barcelona in the King’s Cup, must pick up his team for Sunday’s trip to Real Betis where he will be looking for a first win in nine La Liga matches.
headline: Neville Looks to Pick Up the Valencia Pieces at Betis

text: Major U.S. airlines United and Delta and Europe's Lufthansa and Air France are offering to re-assign certain flight crew concerned about contracting the Zika virus from routes to affected countries.
headline: Exclusive-Top Airlines Offer to Re-Assign Crew From Zika-Hit Routes

text: Anti-austerity party Podemos would come second if a new national election was held today, overtaking the Socialists, who are currently leading talks to form a government, a survey showed on Thursday.
headline: Opinion Poll Suggests New Obstacles Towards Government Pact in Spain

text: A Yemeni al-Qaida leader was killed in a drone strike overnight in the southern province of Abin, Yemeni tribal officials said Thursday.
headline: Tribal Officials: Drone Strike Kills Yemeni Al-Qaida Leader

text: British Prime Minister David Cameron's spokesman said on Thursday that if WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange leaves the Ecuadorian embassy in London he will be arrested.
headline: UK Says Assange Will Be Arrested if He Leaves Ecuadorian Embassy

text: Yum Brands Inc, the home of KFC and Pizza Hut, is falling behind rival McDonald's Corp as the pair battle to revive flagging sales in China - a headache for Yum as it looks to spin off operations in its biggest market.
headline: Beefed Up: McDonald's Edging Out KFC, Pizza Hut in China Revival Battle

text: Greek police fired teargas at protesters hurling stones at them during brief clashes on the sidelines of a mass rally against pension reforms in central Athens on Thursday, Reuters witnesses said.
headline: Scuffles Break Out in Athens During Rally, Police Fire Teargas

text: Former "Friends" star Matt LeBlanc will be joining the BBC's popular "Top Gear" program, presenting the revamped car show with Chris Evans, the British broadcaster said Thursday.
headline: BBC Says American Actor Matt LeBlanc to Join 'Top Gear'

text: Dozens of people linked to the most recent cases of Ebola in Sierra Leone are still missing, the World Health Organization warns, saying that among them 18 contacts are at high risk of having the virus.
headline: WHO: More Than 48 Ebola Contacts Missing in Sierra Leone

text: Tens of thousands of Syrians are moving toward the Turkish border from the Syrian city of Aleppo due to increased aerial bombardment, Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu said on Thursday at a fundraising conference in London.
headline: 70,000 Refugees Heading to Turkey Due to Increased Bombing in Syria: Turkish PM

text: Dunkin' Brands Group Inc reported a surprise drop in quarterly sales at established U.S. Dunkin' Donuts restaurants as the launch of all-day breakfast by McDonald's Corp and value-meal offers by rivals lured customers away.
headline: Dunkin' Donuts U.S. Store Sales Fall as Competition Heats Up

text: Striker Benik Afobe says he will have nothing to prove on Sunday when Bournemouth entertain title-chasing Arsenal, his former club, in the Premier League.
headline: I've Nothing to Prove to Arsenal, Says Bournemouth's Afobe

text: Signs of torture and cigarette burns were found on the body of an Italian student who had gone missing in Cairo, a senior Egyptian prosecutor said on Thursday.
headline: Signs of Torture, Cigarette Burns Found on Body of Dead Italian: Prosecutor

text: Britain said on Thursday that WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange had avoided arrest by fleeing to the Ecuadorian embassy and that it was under obligation to extradite him to Sweden over an outstanding rape allegation.
headline: UK Says Assange Is Avoiding Arrest, to Extradite Him to Sweden

text: Authorities say an Ohio mother and two young girls were so badly burned that investigators can't determine if they suffered any injuries prior to a fatal house explosion and fire.
headline: Officials Search for Cause of Death for Family in Explosion

text: Sweden's Migration Agency said on Thursday it expected up to 140,000 asylum seekers in 2016 but the government said it would not allow numbers to get anywhere near that, and vowed to introduce further measures to curb the influx if needed.
headline: Swedish Minister Vows to Curb Refugee Flows in 2016

text: Two-time Tour de France champion Chris Froome of England has made a strong start to a new season by finishing second on Thursday's opening stage of the Herald-Sun cycle tour.
headline: Froome Finishes 2nd on 1st Stage of Melbourne Cycle Tour

text: As the Feb. 7 Super Bowl and Valentine's Day near, lingerie retailer Victoria's Secret has released a football-themed advert, with some of its famous faces playing ball.
headline: Victoria's Secret Models Play Ball

text: A Russian military adviser died in a hospital in Syria on Feb. 1 after sustaining serious wounds in a shelling of a Syrian army training center in the province of Homs, Russia's Novaya Gazeta wrote on Thursday, citing Russia's Defence Ministry spokesman.
headline: Russian Military Trainer Was Killed in Syria's Homs: Newspaper

text: An Israeli court jailed two Jewish youths on Thursday, one for life and the other for 21 years, for the murder of a Palestinian teenager in Jerusalem, a crime that helped trigger the 2014 Gaza war.
headline: Israeli Teenagers Get Long Jail Terms for Palestinian Youth's Murder

text: German Foreign Minister Frank Walter Steinmeier said on Thursday that talks for a political solution to end the civil war in Syria were difficult, but he was not without hope.
headline: Germany Says Must Talk With Russia on Humanitarian Situation in Syria

text: Uruguay defender Alvaro Pereira's hopes of making his Getafe debut at Malaga in La Liga on Friday have been dashed by an eight-match ban imposed by the Argentine FA (AFA).
headline: Argentine FA Bans Trio for Eight Games After Brawl

text: All interested parties have a responsibility for agreeing a ceasefire in Syria, but the regime of President Bashar al-Assad is responsible above all, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday.
headline: Assad Above All Responsible for Ceasefire in Syria, Merkel Says

text: Italy's Foreign Ministry on Thursday summoned the Egyptian ambassador to Rome to express concern about the suspicious death of an Italian man in Cairo and to urge a joint investigation, according to a statement.
headline: Italy Summons Egyptian Ambassador Over Suspicious Cairo Death

text: Support for Slovakia's ruling leftist Smer party is at its lowest for more than year ahead of a March election, suggesting that it will not only not win a majority but that it may even have tough time forming a coalition, a poll showed on Thursday.
headline: Slovakia's Ruling Leftists Losing Support Before March Election-Poll

text: Israel's Tax Authority says it wants a cut of gratuities traditionally offered to Jewish ritual circumcisors and a slice of the payments that private kosher inspectors usually pocket.
headline: Israeli Taxman Eyes Off-The-Books 'Religious Services Industry'

text: A consortium of Gulf Arab investors has agreed to buy a majority stake in Middle Eastern food firm Kuwait Food Company, which operates regional franchises of KFC, Krispy Kreme and other well-known Western brands.
headline: Gulf Investors to Buy Majority Stake in Kuwait's Americana

text: Saudi Arabia said on Thursday it was ready to participate in any ground operations in Syria if the U.S.-led alliance decides to start such operations, an adviser to the Saudi defence minister said.
headline: Saudi Says Ready to Take Part in Any U.S.-Led Ground Operations in Syria

text: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Friday:
headline: 10 Things to Know for Friday

text: As Gov. Matt Bevin prepares to remake Kentucky's Medicaid program, a new national survey shows what's at stake: gains in insurance coverage matched only by one other state.
headline: Kentucky Tops Coverage Gains as GOP Looks to Remake Medicaid

text: Bayern Munich will not be deterred by what the club say are false reports of discontent in coach Pep Guardiola's team as they focus on becoming the first side to win a fourth straight Bundesliga title.
headline: Magical Four Driving Bayern in Guardiola Swansong

text: Thailand launched a campaign on Thursday urging citizens to get used to carrying condoms, as it battles a reluctance to use protection in the fight against HIV and teen pregnancies.
headline: Don't Shy Away From Condoms, Thailand Says Ahead of Valentine's Day

text: Syrian peace talks have been undermined by a sudden increase in aerial bombing and military activity in the country, United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-Moon said in London on Thursday, urging a return to the negotiating table.
headline: Increased Bombing Has Undermined Syria Peace Talks: U.N. Chief Ban

text: Swiss food giant Nestle has agreed to buy out minority shareholders in Israel's largest listed foodmaker Osem for about $840 million (575 million pound), increasing foreign ownership of leading Israeli food producers.
headline: Nestle to Buy Rest of Israeli Foodmaker Osem for $840 Million

text: A frenetic year of negotiations and setbacks preceded China National Chemical Corp's (ChemChina) blockbuster $43 billion bid for Swiss seeds and pesticides giant Syngenta.
headline: ChemChina's Syngenta Swoop: a 12-Year Crush, a 12-Month Courtship

text: New France coach Guy Noves has made a bold choice by picking Sevens stalwart Virimi Vakatawa on the wing in a new-look team to face Italy in their opening Six Nations game at home on Saturday.
headline: Sevens Stalwart Vakatawa to Start for New-Look France

text: Rand Paul has ended his presidential campaign after a fifth-place finish in the Iowa caucuses. But the lasting impact of his once promising presidential bid could be a caucus in his home state.
headline: Rand Paul Runs for President, Has to Settle for a Caucus

text: Hackers in China attempted to access over 20 million active accounts on Alibaba Group Holding Ltd's Taobao e-commerce website using Alibaba's own cloud computing service, according to a state media report posted on the Internet regulator's website.
headline: Hackers Attack 20 Million Accounts on Alibaba's Taobao Shopping Site

text: Add aging Western bridge players to the list of desperadoes in Thailand's seaside resort of Pattaya, a sin city rife with prostitution, corruption and foreign and home-grown gangsters.
headline: Western Retirees at Thai Resort Busted for Playing Bridge

text: New England coach Eddie Jones defended his "conservative" first team on Thursday after naming an experienced lineup to face Scotland in the Six Nations in Edinburgh on Saturday and keeping his uncapped trio on the bench.
headline: Jones Defends New England's Old Look

text: Almost half of euro zone countries are facing a clash over EU deficit reduction rules unless they change policies, European Commission forecasts showed, posing a challenge to EU laws that set limits on spending to protect the value of the euro.
headline: Growth, Migration Worries Put EU Deficit Rules to New Test

text: Carolina has tobacco and NASCAR while Denver has legalized marijuana and the Rocky Mountains but come Sunday only one will also be called home of the Super Bowl 50 champions.
headline: Mile High City Takes on Tobacco Road for Super Bowl 50

text: U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov had agreed on the need to discuss how to implement a ceasefire in Syria during a call between the two men on Thursday.
headline: Kerry Says Russia's Lavrov Agrees Need to Discuss Syrian Ceasefire

text: The Latest on migrants seeking sanctuary in Europe (all times local):
headline: The Latest: Sweden Expects 140,000 Asylum-Seekers This Year

text: Greece's economy will be the only one in the European Union to shrink this year, the EU Commission said on Thursday, but the fall is much smaller than previously estimated.
headline: Greek GDP to Fall in 2016, but by Less Than Expected-EU Commission

text: Euro zone economic growth will slightly accelerate this year and next, the European Commission estimated on Thursday, but the pace will be slower in 2016 than previously forecast because of increased global risks.
headline: Euro Zone GDP to Grow Moderately in 2016, 2017-Commission

text: The crew of an oil tanker hijacked in Nigerian waters is from Russia, Georgia and the Philippines and is probably being held hostage for ransom, a shipping security expert said Thursday.
headline: Russian, Filipino Seamen Held Hostage in Nigeria _ Expert

text: Germany pledged to give 2.3 billion euros ($2.56 billion) in aid to Syria by 2018, including 1.1 billion euros this year alone, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Thursday at the start of a donor conference in London.
headline: Germany Pledges 2.3 Billion Euros to Syria Aid

text: A Maryland prosecutor on Thursday sought to poke holes in the testimony of an alibi witness who says she chatted with a convicted killer at a library about the time prosecutors say his high school girlfriend was killed in a case that was profiled on the "Serial" podcast.
headline: Witness in 'Serial' Case Is Cross-Examined, Sticks to Story

text: Rebels in Aleppo will soon be completely encircled, a Syrian army source said on Thursday, as the military continues operations near the city after cutting the insurgents' most important supply route from the Turkish border.
headline: Syrian Army Source Sees Aleppo Encircled Soon

text: A Chinese journalist and rights activist who disappeared in Thailand last month is in police custody in China and is under investigation, his wife said on Thursday.
headline: Missing Chinese Journalist Under Investigation in China-Wife

text: U.S. Defense Secretary Ash Carter said on Wednesday the U.S. military was keeping a vigilant eye on North Korea’s missile and nuclear programs, and was continually expanding its defenses against a possible missile attack by Pyongyang.
headline: Pentagon Chief Says U.S. Keeping Eye on North Korea's Missile Program

text: Russia strongly called on North Korea on Thursday to refrain from a planned rocket launch this month, saying such actions could further escalate tension in Northeast Asia, Russia's Foreign Ministry said.
headline: Russia 'Strongly Calls' on North Korea to Refrain From Planned Rocket Launch

text: France's top security official said investigators have dismantled 25 migrant smuggling networks in the country's north in the past year.
headline: France Dismantles 25 Migrant Smuggling Networks Over a Year

text: Everton midfielder Ross Barkley should no longer be considered a young prospect but regarded as a player who can marshal and inspire his team, manager Roberto Martinez said.
headline: Martinez Believes Barkley Has Come of Age as a Player

text: A federal jury has awarded $23.1 million to a black man who was shot and paralyzed by a Florida sheriff's deputy who thought he was armed, but it could be years before the 22-year-old man might see any of the money — if ever.
headline: Jurors Award $23.1 Million to Man Shot by Deputy in Florida

text: Greek bus drivers and migrant passengers seeking to reach western Europe blocked traffic on the main highway running north to Macedonia on Thursday, tempers fraying over the slow pace of passage over the border.
headline: Greek Bus Drivers, Migrants Block Highway Over Border Impasse

text: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan said Syrian peace talks in Geneva, which were suspended on Wednesday, were pointless while President Bashar al-Assad's forces and Russia continued their attacks in the country.
headline: Turkey's Erdogan Says Syria Talks Pointless While Russian Attacks Continue

text: Germany registered 91,671 migrants in January, less than half November's level, officials said on Thursday as pressure mounted on Chancellor Angela Merkel to deliver on her pledge to reduce the influx.
headline: Number of Migrants Registering in Germany Falls Markedly in January

text: Chinese clubs spent more per player than any other country in the January transfer window, according to data from FIFA's Transfer Matching System (TMS) seen by the Times.
headline: Chinese Clubs Paid More Per Player Than Europe Elites-Report

text: World heavyweight champion Tyson Fury is struggling for motivation and could quit boxing, the controversial fighter told the BBC on Thursday.
headline: Heavyweight Champion Fury Ready to 'Walk Away'

text: Former pharmaceutical executive Martin Shkreli suffered a roughly $40 million drop in the value of a trading account used to secure his bail following his arrest on securities fraud charges, a U.S. prosecutor said on Wednesday.
headline: Ex-Drug Executive Shkreli Has $40 Million Trading Loss: U.S.

text: Britain's top share index rallied on Thursday, rebounding from the previous session's falls after a drop in the dollar boosted commodity prices and gave a lift to mining and oil shares.
headline: FTSE 100 Gets Boost After Weak Dollar Helps Commodities

text: A heavily pregnant rhino lay in the scrub in a South African wildlife park, sedated by rangers who attached a tracking device to the threatened animal as part of efforts to stop poaching in a country with most of the world's rhinos.
headline: South African Rangers Seek to Track Rhinos in Wildlife Park

text: China's main anti-corruption watchdog said on Thursday it has formally begun an investigation into the former governor of China's populous southwestern province of Sichuan, accusing him of serious "discipline violations".
headline: China Formally Starts Graft Probe of Former Sichuan Governor

text: Honda Motor Co Ltd is expanding its recall in North America of late-model vehicles equipped with potentially defective Takata air bags, adding 2.23 million vehicles.
headline: Honda Adds 2.2 Million Vehicles to Takata Air Bag Recall

text: World food prices fell to near a seven-year low in January, weighed down by declines for agricultural commodities, particularly sugar, the United Nations food agency said on Thursday.
headline: World Food Prices Start 2016 at Near Seven-Year Low

text: Delta Air Lines Inc on Wednesday said President Ed Bastian would replace Richard Anderson as chief executive in May, a long expected move that will see one of the most successful and outspoken leaders in the airline industry retire.
headline: Delta Air Lines CEO to Retire; President Named as Successor

text: A Turkish parliamentary commission is meeting in a fresh push to draft a new constitution that would replace the current charter which is a legacy of the 1980 military coup.
headline: Turkish Parties Hold First Meeting to Draft New Constitution

text: The latest on fighting in Syria and Thursday's Syria aid conference (all times local):
headline: The Latest: 'Like a Siege of Aleppo Is About to Begin'

text: Aston Villa winger Jordan Ayew has apologised for his early dismissal in the 2-0 Premier League defeat by West Ham United and is looking to make amends for the error as soon as possible.
headline: Contrite Ayew Desperate to Make Amends for Red Card

text: Sales of Volkswagen-branded cars in Britain fell for the fourth consecutive month in a row in January, industry data showed on Thursday, despite the overall market growing nearly 3 percent.
headline: UK VW Brand Car Sales Fall Again in January as Market Grows

text: Two Virginia Tech students carefully planned the kidnapping and killing of a 13-year-old girl, arranging a pre-dawn rendezvous online after buying cleaning supplies and a shovel at separate Wal-Mart stores, a prosecutor alleged Thursday.
headline: Prosecutor: Girl Texted With College Man Before Stabbing

text: The body of an Italian graduate student who disappeared last month has been found with multiple stab wounds, cigarette burns and other signs of torture and a "slow death" on a roadside on the outskirts of Cairo, an Egyptian prosecutor said Thursday.
headline: Tortured Italian Student Died 'Slow Death': Egypt Official

text: Celine Dion's husband protected her from the gritty business details of her career as he struck the deals that defined her superstar status, including saying yes to her mega hit from "Titanic" when she wanted to say no.

text: French Airbus Group's helicopter unit said on Thursday talks with Poland's economy ministry were continuing on the delivery of 50 helicopters for the Polish army, denying a media report that the deal had been scrapped.

text: Norway's $810-billion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, said on Thursday it would raise its focus on global human rights to ensure that companies it invests in follow ethical standards.

text: Support for the party of Irish Prime Minister Enda Kenny slipped in the first opinion poll published since the current election campaign started, the latest sign the election may fail to produce a stable government.

text: Anglo-Swedish drug firm AstraZeneca says revenue will decline this year as it loses patent exclusivity in the United States on its top selling anti-cholesterol drug Crestor.

text: Rebels in Aleppo will soon be completely encircled, a Syrian army source said on Thursday, as the military continues operations near the city after cutting the insurgents' most important supply route from the Turkish border.

text: China on Thursday urged participants in Syrian peace talks to show goodwill, after a United Nations envoy halted his attempts to conduct them after Syria's army, backed by Russian air strikes, advanced against rebel forces north of Aleppo.

text: British house prices rose at a much stronger pace than expected last month, fuelled by a shortage of new homes coming to the market, mortgage lender Halifax said on Thursday.

text: No super-steep gradients, no rock-hard ice, no death-defying speeds.
headline: 'No Slow Motion Needed' on Tame Pyeongchang Downhill Course

text: Europe's top economic authorities warned Thursday of the dangers to the region from the slowdown in China, weak inflation and heightened geopolitical uncertainties.
headline: Europe's Top Economic Authorities Warn of Risks to Growth

text: German forces arrested two men on Thursday suspected of links to Islamic State militants preparing an attack in the German capital, police and prosecutors said, amid fears of another deadly attack on European soil.
headline: German Police Raids Over Possible Islamic State Attack

text: The European Central Bank lowered the cap on emergency liquidity assistance (ELA) Greek banks can draw from the domestic central bank by 0.3 billion euros to 71.5 billion euros ($79.3 billion), the Bank of Greece said on Thursday.

text: German police conducted raids and arrested two suspects on Thursday in an investigation of four Algerian men who are suspected of planning an attack in Germany and having ties to the Islamic State group.

text: The body of an Italian student who went missing in Cairo was found half naked by the roadside with cigarette burns and other signs of torture, a senior Egyptian prosecutor said on Thursday.

text: State-owned China National Chemical Corp [CNNCC.UL], which plans to buy Swiss seeds and pesticide maker Syngenta, will promptly start preparations for what could be a lengthy U.S. national security review, as the House Agriculture Committee chairman said he would monitor the deal.
headline: ChemChina, Syngenta to Move Quickly on U.S. National Security Review

text: The face-to-face meeting between Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders is rooted in an intensifying debate over who understands the great divide between rich Americans and everyone else.
headline: Viewer's Guide: Clinton, Sanders Clash Over Economic Divide

text: West Ham United striker Andy Carroll is fit to face Southampton in the Premier League on Saturday after recovering from the hamstring injury he suffered against Bournemouth last month, but new signing Sam Byram has been ruled out for a week.
headline: West Ham's Carroll Fit for Southampton, Byram Ruled Out

text: The ability to train and advise the still green Afghan security forces will be constrained if the U.S. troop level is cut to 5,500 as President Barack Obama has proposed, the senior American commander in Afghanistan said on Thursday.

text: The risk of acting too late on ultra-low inflation is greater than that of acting too early, European Central Bank President Mario Draghi said on Thursday, suggesting more policy easing may be needed.

text: Just days before the Bank of Japan stunned financial markets with its radical adoption of negative interest rates, members of the central bank's own policy board had also been taken by surprise by the move.
headline: Insight-BOJ Board Among Those Surprised by Negative Interest Rate Plan

text: A leading American Jewish group promoting therapy it said could turn gays to heterosexuals was ordered shut in December by a New Jersey court, amid growing efforts in the U.S. to curb the generally discredited practice. But therapists with ties to the shuttered group say they have found a haven for their work in Israel.
headline: 'Gay Conversion' Therapists Find Safe Haven in Israel

text: Nudging Colombia toward a peace deal that's finally within reach, President Barack Obama committed the United States on Thursday to helping the battle-scarred nation rebuild after half a century of guerrilla conflict.
headline: Peace Deal in Reach, Obama Says US to Help Colombia Rebuild

text: Iranian authorities on Wednesday detained a former BBC Persian service reporter, an Iranian opposition website reported.
headline: Iran Authorities Detain Former BBC Persian Reporter

text: The food industry is pressuring Congress to act before the state of Vermont requires food labels for genetically modified ingredients.
headline: Food Industry Looks to Congress as GMO Labeling Law Nears

text: British police said on Thursday they will arrest WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange if he leaves the Ecuadorian embassy in London.

text: British police said on Thursday they will arrest WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange if he leaves the Ecuadorian embassy in London.
headline: British Police to Arrest Wikileaks Founder Assange if He Leaves the Ecuadorian Embassy

text: The Supreme Court's recent decision to step into a relatively unimportant case involving Microsoft's Xbox 360 gaming system revealed that Chief Justice John Roberts has sold between $250,000 and $500,000 in Microsoft stock in the past year.
headline: Roberts Sold More Than $250,000 in Microsoft Stock

text: Kevin Durant turned the conversation back to the court and away from his impending free agency with a final-second jump shot that lifted the Oklahoma City Thunder to a 117-114 victory over Orlando Magic on Wednesday.
headline: Durant Puts Free Agency Talk on Back Burner to Sink Magic

text: John Kasich is betting big on positivity.
headline: Kasich Keeps It Positive in Final Days Before New Hampshire

text: Republican presidential candidate Marco Rubio is using every bit of momentum his campaign received from the Iowa caucuses to show New Hampshire voters that he — not his competition — is the Republican for all Americans.
headline: Rubio Looks to NH to Peg Himself as a Republican for All

text: Sterling could fall as much as 15-20 percent if Britain votes to leave the European Union, a scenario that could alarm foreign investors and dry up the capital inflows needed to fund the current account deficit, Goldman Sachs said on Thursday.
headline: Sterling Could Fall 15-20 Percent if Britain Leaves EU-Goldman

text: Fireworks flying in their first one-on-one debate, Hillary Clinton accused Bernie Sanders Thursday night of subjecting her to an "artful smear" while Sanders suggested the former secretary of state was a captive of America's political establishment.
headline: Fireworks Fly as Clinton, Sanders Square Off Before NH

text: "I don't know anyone who would be comfortable with someone who behaves this way having his finger on the button. We're liable to wake up one morning and Donald, if he were president, would have nuked Denmark." — Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz on Donald Trump, who accused the Texas senator of "fraud" and called for a do-over of the Iowa caucuses.
headline: Quotations in the News

text: The number of anti-Semitic incidents reported in Britain dropped by a fifth last year, although the figure was still the third-highest on record, a Jewish advisory body said on Thursday.
headline: Number of Anti-Semitic Incidents in Britain Falls

text: Daimler AG expects slower sales growth for its Mercedes-Benz cars in China this year after a surge in demand in 2015 that helped the automaker post record sales and earnings.
headline: Daimler Sees Slower Growth in 2016 as China Cools

text: Signing day 2016 is in the books, and the race for top 2017 quarterback prospects began long before it ended.
headline: Recruiting Continues, Several Top 2017 QBs Already Committed

text: Roadside recovery firm AA said on Thursday it had started underwriting insurance, adding to its existing insurance broking business.
headline: Roadside Recovery Firm AA Starts Insurance Underwriting Business

text: Tour de France champion Chris Froome presented a token of appreciation to team mate Peter Kennaugh by allowing the 26-year-old to claim a stage victory and the overall lead of the Herald Sun Tour on Thursday.
headline: Froome Repays Kennaugh as Sky Pair Dominate Stage

text: Watford skipper Troy Deeney said he would warn team mate Juan Carlos Paredes about play-acting after the defender fell to the ground theatrically following a clash with Chelsea striker Diego Costa during the 0-0 Premier League draw on Wednesday night.
headline: Watford Skipper to Talk to Paredes About Play-Acting

text: Turkey has rejected a Russian request for a routine observation flight over its territory under a decade-old pact meant to enhance mutual confidence, a move Moscow said set "a dangerous precedent".
headline: Turkey Rejects Russian Request for Routine Observation Flight

text: Last year's Super Bowl is best remembered for a team's unsuccessful decision to throw on what appeared to be an obvious running down near the goal line, the sort of thing that maybe shouldn't surprise anyone, given the emphasis on passing in today's NFL.
headline: From Riggins to Allen to Elway, the Best Super Bowl Runs

text: Lloyd's of London insurer Beazley Plc reported a rise in full-year return on equity to 19 percent, but said it would not mirror the rise in 2016, as falling rates continue to put pressure on margins.
headline: Insurer Beazley Sees Falling Rates, Margin Pressure in 2016

text: Bavaria's governor is drawing criticism in Germany for traveling to meet Russian President Vladimir Putin and sounding a softer tone on sanctions than his country's government.
headline: German State Governor Draws Criticism Over Putin Visit

text: An Israeli court on Thursday sentenced two Israeli minors for the murder of a 16-year-old Palestinian in 2014, sending one to life in prison for a crime that provoked deep soul-searching in Israel and was one of a series of events that led to the Gaza war later that year.
headline: Israeli Court Sentences 2 Over Palestinian Teenager's Murder

text: Royal Dutch Shell said fourth-quarter earnings tumbled 44 percent as the collapse in oil prices took its toll on another global energy giant.
headline: Oil Price Drop Pushes Shell Profit Down 44 Percent

text: Perwin Shamsaddeen Ali, a Syrian refugee living in a tent camp in northern Iraq, has been reduced to cooking one meal a day for her family of four.
headline: Syrian Refugees Struggle to Buy Food as Aid Dwindles

text: A top Federal Reserve official said on Thursday he backs tougher stress tests for "too big to fail" banks including higher capital requirements that would make them "even more binding."
headline: Fed Official Backs Tougher Bank Stress Tests

text: German car and truck maker Daimler has reported record profits for last year as sales of its luxury cars rose despite a troubled global economy.

text: AstraZeneca warned on Thursday that revenue and earnings would drop this year due to the arrival of cheap generic rivals to Crestor, its top-selling cholesterol drug, which will offset growth in sales of newer medicines.

text: Royal Dutch Shell, Europe's largest oil company, reported its lowest annual income in over a decade on Thursday and said it would take further steps to cut costs to cope with weak oil prices if needed.
headline: Shell Ready for More Cost Cuts as Earnings Fall 87 Percent on Weak Oil Prices

text: More than 91,000 asylum seekers arrived in Germany last month, the government said Thursday, underlining the pressure the country faces to diminish the influx of migrants.
headline: Germany: Over 91,000 Asylum-Seekers Arrived in January

text: Smith & Nephew, Europe's largest maker of artificial hips and knees, forecast a rise in underlying revenue this year, but said its profit margin could fall due to the U.S. dollar's strength against emerging market currencies.
headline: Smith & Nephew Sees Revenues Up, but Forex to Hit Margins

text: Britain's Compass Group, the world's biggest catering firm, posted a 5.9 percent rise in first quarter group revenue on the back of strong demand for its services in the United States and Europe.
headline: Compass' First Quarter Revenue Rises 5.9 Percent

text: Scuffles broke out and police used teargas during a mass rally in Athens on Thursday as Greeks railed against government pension reforms needed to meet demands of international creditors.
headline: Greek Police Turn to Teargas as Tempers Flare Over Pensions

text: Mobile phone company Vodafone delivered its sixth consecutive quarter of underlying revenue growth on Thursday, as Germany and Italy led an improvement in Europe, its biggest regional business.
headline: Vodafone Says Recovery in Europe Still on Track

text: Credit Suisse is cutting roughly 4,000 jobs to reduce costs after announcing a massive pre-tax loss in the fourth quarter that includes "substantial charges which are not reflective of our underlying business performance," the bank said Thursday.
headline: Credit Suisse Announces 4,000 Job Cuts Amid Big Q4 Loss

text: Newcastle United put in an "unacceptable" performance during their 3-0 Premier League defeat to Everton on Wednesday, manager Steve McClaren has said.
headline: McClaren Laments Wasted Game as Newcastle Slump at Everton

text: An EU watchdog said on Wednesday it needed time to study a new EU-U.S. agreement on data transfers to determine whether the United States was committed to limiting intelligence surveillance of Europeans.
headline: EU Watchdog Says Needs Time to Study Data Deal With United States

text: An anti-abortion activist's plan to reject a plea deal offering probation for charges related to making undercover Planned Parenthood videos likely means his goal is to use a trial as a public platform to criticize the nonprofit, according to legal experts.
headline: Activist Behind Planned Parenthood Video Offered Probation

text: An economic battle is likely for dominance of the skies over the Gulf after Iran decided to invest $27 billion in an airline fleet capable of taking on the region's supercarriers.
headline: Airline Battle Brews in Gulf as Iran Eyes Regional Hub Role

text: Iraq is trying to persuade satellite firms to halt Internet services in areas under Islamic State's rule, seeking to deal a major blow to the group's potent propaganda machine which relies heavily on social media to inspire its followers to wage jihad.
headline: To Silence Propaganda, Iraq Seeks to Take Islamic State Offline

text: Cannon fire followed by a rain of confetti heralded the start Thursday of Cologne's annual Carnival, when hundreds of thousands of revelers take to the streets and pubs of the ancient German city for five days of boisterous partying.
headline: New Year's Attacks Overshadow Start of Cologne Carnival

text: Troubled Japanese electronics maker Sharp plans to decide within a month between investment offers from Taiwanese company Hon Hai, also known as Foxconn, or a consortium of Japanese investors.
headline: Sharp Weighs Investment Proposals, Decision Within a Month

text: World leaders pledged more than $10 billion Thursday to help fund schools, shelter and jobs for refugees from Syria's civil war, money that British Prime Minister David Cameron said "will save lives, will give hope, will give people the chance of a future."
headline: World Pledges $10B for Syrians, but Peace Prospects Bleak

text: Australia coach Darren Lehmann has been cleared to fly to New Zealand after recovering from deep vein thrombosis and will join the squad on Saturday ahead of their third and final one-day international against the hosts.
headline: Australia Coach Lehmann Cleared to Join Squad in NZ

text: South Korea and Japan vowed to shoot down any debris that falls on their territories from a long-range rocket that North Korea plans to fire this month, with Seoul saying Thursday that it has detected launch preparations by Pyongyang.

text: In the humble zoo, among the small cages of owls, guinea pigs and raccoons, Japan's oldest elephant stands in a concrete pen about the size of half of a basketball court. text: The National Park Service is celebrating its 100th anniversary this year, but the system faces a multibillion dollar maintenance backlog that officials say is no cause for rejoicing.

text: Warm weather in Maine has forced the National Toboggan Championships to be postponed on Friday, shortened to one day and moved to a new location.

text: Spain's anti-austerity Podemos party said on Friday it would only start negotiations to form a government with the Socialists and end months of political deadlock if leader Pedro Sanchez abandoned talks with the centrist Ciudadanos.

text: Two prominent Turkish journalists will be charged with assisting terrorists and face life sentences without parole if convicted, their lawyers said, after they published video footage purporting to show the state intelligence agency helping to send weapons to Syria.

text: Prime Minister David Cameron said on Friday that any deal agreed with the European Union on reforming Britain's relationship with the bloc would be irreversible.

text: A bus plunged off a bridge into a river in western India on Friday, killing 25 people and injuring 20 others, an official said.

text: Grain futures were lower Friday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

text: A music video with more than 33 million views online has inspired organizers of a Moscow art exhibit to offer free admission to women who turn up wearing high heels.

text: England rugby union captain Dylan Hartley must earn the respect of referees if he is to become a great leader and justify his appointment by Eddie Jones, according to former South Africa and Italy coach Nick Mallett.

text: In a protest about the plight of migrants coming to Europe, Chinese artist and activist Ai Weiwei has wrapped golden thermal blankets around his bronze animal heads meant to recreate the traditional Chinese zodiac.

text: Barack Obama might seem an unlikely investor in the firearms industry. But the U.S. president, a fierce advocate for gun regulation, has money in a pension fund that holds stock in gun and ammunition companies.

text: Barack Obama might seem an unlikely investor in the firearms industry. But the U.S. president, a fierce advocate for gun regulation, has money in a pension fund that holds stock in gun and ammunition companies.

text: World media executives are urging governments to stop looking at journalists as the enemy, and to better protect reporters covering wars, crime and corruption.

text: Julian Assange, founder of WikiLeaks, has been fighting to avoid extradition to Sweden, which wants to question him about allegations of rape. He has spent more than three years inside the Embassy of Ecuador in London to avoid being sent to Sweden and possibly forced to go to the United States to face charges there. A United Nations panel said Friday that he has been unlawfully detained by Swedish and British authorities. Here are key events in the Assange saga:
headline: Chronicle of Julian Assange's Battle Against Extradition

text: Vladimir Putin thinks Russian air strikes in Syria have helped turn the war's tide but the pace of the Syrian army's advance has frustrated him, some sources say. If Aleppo falls, he could get the military and symbolic prize he has been craving.

text: An Ohio man armed with a pellet gun was shot and killed by a sheriff's deputy who had responded to a 911 call from the man's wife, who said she had been stabbed multiple times, officials said on Friday.

text: In a tug of war over budgets, the European Commission approved Portugal's so-called anti-austerity spending plan on Friday, but only after extracting a promise for almost $1 billion in additional cost cuts.

text: Backed by an increase in U.S. military spending, NATO is planning its biggest build-up in eastern Europe since the Cold War to deter Russia but will reject Polish demands for permanent bases.

text: On a remote island off of Nantucket, scientists are using a tool most commonly associated with war and surveillance to get a look at fuzzy baby seals.

text: Ukraine needs a new technocratic government led by the present finance minister to have any hope of pushing through long-promised reforms, the outgoing economy minister told Reuters on Friday, two days after his shock resignation.

text: A Bosnian tycoon and head of a party in the ruling coalition  was indicted on Friday of organising a criminal group to obstruct justice and offer political favours in a high-profile court case against an accused Balkan drug boss.

text: In this photo by Mark Schiefelbein, Switzerland's Nils Mani skis during the second training session for a World Cup downhill event in Jeongseon, South Korea, that also is a test event for the Pyeongchang 2018 Winter Olympics. The Jeongseon Alpine Center is rare in that it has only the competition course, a training run and a slalom course and the venue will be restored to its natural state when the games end. The area forest is a pilgrimage site for women who pray for fertility at certain sacred trees, and the local Gangwon province decided on the forest restoration in agreement with environmentalists years earlier. Some ski officials say a permanent facility would be used by Koreans and would help grow the sport.
headline: Image of Asia: Testing Downhill Course for Olympic Skiers

text: Britain must be able to tackle any abuse of its welfare system by migrants, but that cannot come at the price of discriminating against EU citizens, European Parliament President Martin Schulz said on Friday.

text: Law enforcement officers have linked Blake Fitzgerald and Brittany Nicole Harper to a spree of abductions and robberies in Missouri, Alabama, Georgia and Florida. text: A state judge ruled Friday against an effort by preservationists to stop the removal of prominent Confederate monuments in New Orleans.

text: The Syrian government's military offensive around the city of Aleppo has prompted at least 15,000 people to flee and involved a reported 13 airstrikes on medical facilities in January, the United Nations said on Friday.

text: WASHINGTON - The U.S. trade deficit widened in December as a strong dollar and weak global demand continued to weigh on exports.

text: The U.S. trade deficit rose in December as American exports fell for a third straight month, reflecting the pressures of a stronger dollar and spreading global weakness. text: Consider looking past January's so-so job growth.

text: A deputy confronting a man who had just stabbed his wife fired two fatal shots after the man ignored several warnings to drop what turned out to be a pellet gun and said "it's time to die," an Ohio sheriff said Friday.
